member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AnimatedGif
member.summary: Allows one to add individual images, or Bitmaps, to a chart to create an animation or slideshow.
member.remarks: To use this class you must assign each frame of the animation. You can also define the speed of the animation.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AnimatedGif.ExportAnimatedGif(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the animated gif to a file on disk.
member.param: The filename to save the Animated Gif under.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AnimatedGif.FrameList
member.summary: Sets or gets an ArrayList object containing Image objects.
member.remarks: The order in which images are added to the FrameList is the same order the animation will display the images.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AnimatedGif.FrameSpeed
member.summary: Defines amount of time, in hundredths of a second, frames are displayed.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AnimatedGif.LoopCount
member.summary: Defines the number of times the animation will loop.
member.remarks: If LoopCount is zero, the animation will continually loop. Set LoopCount to 1 if you want the animation to run only one time.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AnimatedGif.TransparentWhiteEnabled
member.summary: Controls whether or not there will be transparency in the Animated Gif.

remarks.para: If enabled, the Animated Gif will show transparency wherever there is a white colored pixel.
If disabled, the Animated Gif will display the original images without any modifications.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Axis2DLinear

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase
member.summary: This is the base axis class. All axis objects are derived from this base.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PropertyObject

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an instance of this type.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.GetUserLabel(System.Double)
member.summary: Retrieves a user defined label for the specified value.
member.returns: Returns an object for the label corresponding to the specified value. Returns null if a user-defined label does not exist for the value.
member.param: Value for which a user defined label is returned.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.SetUserLabel(System.Double,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a user defined label for the specified value.
member.remarks: When overriding a category-based axis label, the specified value should be an integer. Note, however, that labels can be overridden for real numbers (e.g. 0.25, 1.6).
member.param: Value for which to override label.
The user label, typically a string but can be a number.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.RemoveAllUserLabels
member.summary: Removes all the user labels currently set for the axis.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.AxisLabelGenerator
member.summary: Sets and gets an instance of a user-defined class that will generate axis labels for the visible tick marks.
member.remarks:
This property can be used to implement a label generator of your own design. The object assigned to the property must support the interface. If this object is present, then the axis label generator will get first try at creating a label.
For an example showing how to use the AxisLabelGenerator property with a custom label-generating object, see Creating Custom Labels.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.MajorTickGenerator
member.summary: Sets and gets an instance of a user-defined class that will generate axis major ticks.

remarks.para: This property allows a developer to implement their own major tick generation. If MajorTickGenerator is implemented, then MajorTickCount and MajorTickInterval will not be used.
Note: IMajorTickGenerator is currently only implemented for the AxisX, AxisY, AxisXPrime, AxisYPrime.
See for a code example on how to use the MajorTickGenerator property.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.LabelSeries
member.summary: Sets and gets the Series object for category-based labels.
member.remarks:
To use this property, create a Series object and bind data to the Label component. Then simply assign the Series object to this property.
Note that assigning a Series object to this property causes the chart to read only the Label component of the series. If you want the chart to read data in other components of the series, you must add the Series object to the chart using the AddSeries method.

example.code:
'Get data from an OLEDB Data Provider Dim dp As OleDBDataProvider = New OleDBDataProvider()
'TODO: Replace the ConnectionString with one that is valid on your system dp.ConnectionString = "Provider=SQLOLEDB;Integrated Security=SSPI;" _ + "Initial Catalog=Northwind;Data Source=(local)\VSDotNet" dp.SelectString = "SELECT CategoryName, CategorySales FROM [Category Sales for 1997]" dp.OpenConnection()
'Bind fields of the database to components of a data series Dim sales As New Series() sales.SeriesName = "Category Sales" sales.BindComponent(SeriesComponent.Y, dp, "CategorySales") sales.BindComponent(SeriesComponent.Label, dp, "CategoryName")
With Me.GSNetWinChart1.Chart 'Remove any previously loaded series .RemoveAllSeries() 'Send data to chart Dim SalesIndex As Integer = .AddSeries(sales) 'Add category labels .Grid.AxisPie.LabelSeries = sales 'Category labels show in a pie chart's legend End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.MaxDisplayedLabelChars
member.summary: Sets and gets the maximum number of axis label characters to display when axis labels exist.
member.remarks: This property is ignored when the value is zero.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.GridLinesOn
member.summary: Controls whether grid lines are displayed for the axis.
member.remarks:
Grid lines are rules extending perpendicularly from the axis, one line for each major tick.
The setting of this property is specific to the axis. If you want to turn grid lines on for both the X and Y axis, then you must set this property to true in both the AxisX object and the AxisY object.

example.code: With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart.Grid 'Turn grid lines on for X and Y axes .AxisX.GridLinesOn = True .AxisY.GridLinesOn = True 'Make grid lines dotted .AxisX.GridLineProperties.DashStyle = System.Drawing.Drawing2D.DashStyle.Dot .AxisY.GridLineProperties.DashStyle = System.Drawing.Drawing2D.DashStyle.Dot End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.GridLineProperties
member.summary: Gets the Line object that draws grid lines for this axis. This property provides access to the properties of the underlying Line object.
member.remarks: See the Line class for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.AxisMode
member.summary: Sets or gets the numeric mode (category, date, linear, or log) for the axis.
member.remarks:
See the AxisMode enumeration for more information on the axis modes supported.
Note that a chart with more than one axis can have different modes applied to each axis. For example, a bar chart may have a category-based X axis and a value- based linear Y axis.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.LabelProperties
member.summary: Gets the TextPainter object that controls how axis labels are drawn. This property provides access to the properties of the underlying TextPainter object.
member.remarks: See the TextPainter class for specific property information.

example.code: With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart.Grid 'Set axis label color .AxisX.LabelProperties.Color = Color.DimGray .AxisY.LabelProperties.Color = Color.DimGray 'Set label trimming mode for X axis .AxisX.LabelProperties.TextTrimmingMode = StringTrimming.Word End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.LabelOffset
member.summary: Sets and gets the offset from the axis for axis labels.
member.remarks:
This value is an integer. There is no real upper limit, but if the value is large enough the labels will paint outside the grid area and hence not be visible.
For a Radar axis, this offset is for the value labels that paint beside the tick marks. The labels that are the end of each spoke use the SpokeLabelOffset value.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.LabelFormatMask
member.summary: Sets and gets the mask for formatting axis label and marker label strings.
member.remarks: This property accepts any format string that is accepted by the .NET Framework ToString() method. For more information, see "Custom Numeric Format Strings" and "Custom DateTime Format Strings" in the .NET Framework Developer's Guide.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.Color
member.summary: Sets and gets the color of the axis.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.LineWidth
member.summary: Sets and gets the line width of the axis.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisBase.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the axis.
member.remarks: The name text is not displayed but can be used to retrieve an axis from the AxisXList or AxisYList. See the example for the GetAxis method.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an instance of this type.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.GetTotalDataPoints
member.summary: Returns the greatest number of data points that can display on the axis, given the series data assigned to the chart.
member.returns: Number of data points.

remarks.para: If there are multiple series and each series contains a different number of data points, the returned value is the number of data points in the largest series. For example, if two series are displayed on the chart, and one series has six data points while the other has five, this method returns six.

Note that this number does not reflect how many data points are currently displayed on the axis. It is possible, for example, that some data points are marked as hidden (see HideDataPoint), or that only a select range of data points is on display (see StartDataPoint and EndDataPoint). GetTotalDataPoints() simply finds the largest series and returns the number of data points in it.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.GetActiveMinValue
member.summary: Returns the current starting value of the axis range.
member.remarks: The active minimum value is the value that the axis system is currently using for the start of the axis. This value is assigned internally at the time the chart does a ReconcileLayout(). It is based on a combination of the AxisMode, the minimum calculated axis value, and the user defined minimum value.
member.returns: A double representing the active minimum value.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.GetActiveMaxValue
member.summary: Returns the current ending value of the axis range.
member.remarks: The active maximum value is the value that the axis system is currently using for the end of the axis range. This value is assigned internally at the time the chart does a ReconcileLayout(). It is based on a combination of the AxisMode, the maximum calculated axis value, and the user defined maximum value.
member.returns: A double representing the active maximum value.

example.code:
' Prepare data for the chart Dim series_0 As New Series Dim series_1 As New Series Dim dataPoint As Integer = 0 For dataPoint = 0 To 5 series_0.SetValue(SeriesComponent.Y, dataPoint, (7 + dataPoint) * 2) series_1.SetValue(SeriesComponent.Y, dataPoint, (7 - dataPoint) * 3) Next With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart 'Remove any previously loaded series .RemoveAllSeries()
'Send new data to chart Dim index_0 As Integer = .AddSeries(series_0) Dim index_1 As Integer = .AddSeries(series_1)
'Set chart type .ChartType = ChartType.Bar2D
'Y axis .Grid.AxisY.AxisMode = AxisMode.ValueLinear .Grid.AxisY.AxisScale = AxisScaleType.AutoRound
'Draw the chart .RecalcLayout()
'Show axis values Dim msg As String = "Max Active Value: " + Convert.ToString(.Grid.AxisY.GetActiveMaxValue()) + vbCrLf + _ "Min Active Value: " + Convert.ToString(.Grid.AxisY.GetActiveMinValue()) + vbCrLf + _ "Max Calculated Value: " + Convert.ToString(.Grid.AxisY.GetCalculatedMaxValue()) + vbCrLf + _ "Min Calculated Value: " + Convert.ToString(.Grid.AxisY.GetCalculatedMinValue()) MessageBox.Show(msg) End With

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.GetCalculatedMinValue
member.summary: Returns the calculated minimum value that can display on the axis.
member.remarks: The calculated minimum value is assigned internally based on the axis and the type of chart that has been selected. This value is typically the minimum value across the series data that will display on the axis. For some chart types, however, this value may be calculated differently. For example, a Z cluster 3D bar chart sets the Z axis minimum value to 0 and the maximum value to the total number of series that are active.
member.returns: A double representing the calculated minimum value.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.GetCalculatedMaxValue
member.summary: Returns the calculated maximum value that can display on the axis.
member.remarks: The calculated maximum value is assigned internally based on the axis and the type of chart that has been selected. This value is typically the maximum value across the series data that will display on the axis. For some chart types, however, this value may be calculated differently. For example, a Z cluster 3D bar chart sets the Z axis minimum value to 0 and the maximum value to the total number of series that are active.
member.returns: A double representing the calculated maximum value.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.AxisScale
member.summary: Specifies where and how an axis obtains the value range for the axis.
member.remarks:
An axis can be scaled only if two conditions are met. First, the AxisMode property must be set to some value other than Category. Second, the chart data must contain values for the SeriesComponent that corresponds to the axis.
For example, stacked, two-dimensional bar charts do not support scaling of the X axis. When the ChartType is BarStacked2D, the AxisMode property of the X axis is forced to Category, and any setting for the AxisScaleType property of the X axis is ignored.
Among three-dimensional charts, the only ChartType that allows scaling of the X and Z axes is Scatter3D.
For information on types of scaling available, see the AxisScaleType enumeration.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.MinAxisValueUser
member.summary: Sets and gets the lower limit of the range of values measured along the axis.
member.remarks: The setting for this property has no effect until the AxisScale property is set to AxisScaleType.UserDefined.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.MaxAxisValueUser
member.summary: Sets and gets the upper limit of the range of values measured along the axis.
member.remarks: The setting for this property has no effect until the AxisScale property is set to AxisScaleType.UserDefined.

example.code: With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart 'Y axis .Grid.AxisY.AxisMode = AxisMode.ValueLinear .Grid.AxisY.AxisScale = AxisScaleType.UserDefined .Grid.AxisY.MaxAxisValueUser = 25 .Grid.AxisY.MinAxisValueUser = 0 End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.MajorTickInterval
member.summary: Sets and gets the interval between major tick marks.

remarks.para: This property is mutually exclusive with the MajorTickCount property. If both properties are set, the MajorTickCount property is used.

Note that when a Date axis is active (AxisMode.Date) then the MajorTickInterval should contain a TimeSpan.Ticks value. For example, if a tick mark is desired every 5 minutes, then MajorTickInterval can be set to TimeSpan(0,0,5,0,0).Ticks (i.e., the number of 100-nanosecond intervals in 5 minutes).

example.code: With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart 'Y axis .Grid.AxisY.TickMode = TickMode.OnStartAtZero .Grid.AxisY.MajorTickInterval = 5 .Grid.AxisY.MajorTickCount = 0 'If count is nonzero, interval is ignored End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.MajorTickCount
member.summary: Sets and gets the total number of major tick marks on the axis.
member.remarks:
Setting this property to a value greater than zero guarantees the axis will always start and end with a major tick mark, even when the AxisScale property is set to AxisScaleType.BestFit.
The MajorTickCount property is mutually exclusive with the MajorTickInterval property. If both properties are set, the MajorTickCount property is used.

value.para: Note: If the tick count is set to a value greater than 500, the drawing engine ignores the setting and defaults to displaying only 10 major ticks. This is a safety valve to prevent the system from trying to draw an excessive number of ticks. It is likely that tick marks will become indistinct well before this limit.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.MinorTicks
member.summary: Sets and gets the number of minor ticks to display between each major tick.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.TickMode
member.summary: Controls whether tick marks are displayed and, if displayed, where they start.
member.remarks: See the TickMode enumeration for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.TickSize
member.summary: Sets and gets the length of the tick marks.
member.remarks: Minor tick marks are always half the size of the major tick marks.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisLinear.IsGapAligned
member.summary: Controls whether data points are aligned on tick marks or on the gaps between tick marks.
member.remarks:
This property applies only to a category-based axis. If the axis is value-based, it is ignored.
When IsGapAligned is set to false, data points are aligned with tick marks. If you have not set the LabelSeries property, data points are labeled with numbers, starting with 0.
When IsGapAligned is set to true, data points are shifted to the right so that they line up in the middle of the gaps between tick marks. If you have not set the LabelSeries property, data point numbering starts with 1.
A setting of true is most useful for bar charts. For that reason, the default IsGapAligned setting for bar charts is true. For all other chart types, the default setting is false.

example.code:
With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart 'Set chart type .ChartType = ChartType.Bar2D
'X axis .Grid.AxisX.AxisMode = AxisMode.Category .Grid.AxisX.IsGapAligned = False .Grid.AxisX.TickMode = TickMode.OnStartAtZero .Grid.AxisX.AxisScale = AxisScaleType.ZeroOrigin
' When the X axis is not gap-aligned and ' the X axis scale is ZeroOrigin, set the ' Y axis position to something other than ' Variable .Grid.AxisY.AxisPosition = AxisPositionType.Left
'Draw the chart .RecalcLayout() End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Axis2DLinear.DisplayOriginLine
member.summary: Draws a line through the origin point of the axis.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true displays a line through the origin point of the axis. This property is useful if the AxisPosition property is forcing the axis crossing point to be some place other than the actual origin.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Axis2DLinear.OriginLine
member.summary: Gets the Line object that draws the optional origin line.
member.remarks: Use this property to access the properties of the underlying Line object. See the class for more information concerning line properties.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Axis2DLinear.TickDrawStyle
member.summary: This property determines how the tick marks will draw.
member.remarks: Tick marks can draw through the axis, above the axis, or below the axis. See the enumeration for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Axis2DLinear.Offset
member.summary: The offset is a pixel value that specifies how far off the visible axis will be drawn from the actual axis edge. If zero, then the visible axis is the same as the actual axis edge.
member.value: Integer representing the space between the actual axis edge and the visible drawn axis.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Axis2DLinear.AxisLineVisible
member.summary: When the AxisLineVisible is true the axis line will be displayed.
member.remarks: When the AxisLineVisible is false, only the axis line will be hidden. The ticks along the axis will still be displayed, whether or not the AxisLineVisible is true or false.
member.value: Bool that displays axis line, or hides axis line.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Axis3DX

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Axis3DX.BarGap
member.summary: Sets and gets the gap between sets of bars.
member.remarks: Valid values can range from 0 to 100 and represent the percentage gap on either side of a set of bars within an interval.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Axis3DX.IsPareto
member.remarks: Setting this property to true sorts the chart's data points based on a descending sort order of the values in the first series added to the chart. Note that each time this value is set to true the existing set of sorted data points will be cleared and then recreated.
member.summary: Determines whether values on the axis are sorted in descending order.

member.summary: Sets and gets the gap between sets of bars.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Axis3DZ.BarDepthToWidthRatio
member.summary: Sets and gets the ratio of bar depth to width.
member.remarks: The larger the value, the longer the bars will be in the Z direction. Note also that this value can be set to less than 1 (e.g. .25).

member.remarks: See the enum for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.StartPosition
member.summary: Defines the angular starting position, where the minimum value displays.
member.remarks: See the enumeration for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.RotationDirection

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.DegreesPerRevolution
member.summary: Sets and gets the number degrees in a full revolution of the axis.
member.remarks: Note that a full revolution is allowed to be greater than 360 degrees.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.MinAxisValueUser
member.summary: Sets and gets a user-defined minimum axis value.
member.remarks: Note that this value will not be active until the AxisScale property is set to AxisScaleType.UserDefined

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.MaxAxisValueUser
member.summary: Sets and gets a user-defined maximum axis value.
member.remarks: Note that this value will not be active until the AxisScale property is set to AxisScaleType.UserDefined

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.MajorTickInterval
member.summary: Sets and gets the interval between major tick marks.
member.remarks: If the tick interval is set such that greater than 500 major tick marks are required to draw, then the engine will ignore this setting and default to displaying only 10 major ticks. This is a safety value to prevent the system from trying to draw an impossibly large number of tick marks.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.TickDrawStyle
member.summary: Determines how the tick marks draw.
member.remarks: For example, the tick marks can draw through the axis, above the axis or below the axis. See the enumeration for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.TickMode
member.summary: Turns tick drawing on and off.
member.remarks: See the enumeration for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.MinorTicks
member.summary: Sets and gets the number of minor ticks to display between each major tick.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.TickSize
member.summary: Sets and gets the size of the tick marks.
member.remarks: The minor ticks marks will always be half the size of the major tick marks.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.LabelUnitsOn
member.summary: Sets and gets whether or not the labels will write out Radians or Degrees () units along with the data value.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.StartAngle
member.summary: Sets and gets the start angle for the axis. This is used in conjunction with StartPostion. The StartPosition must equal UseStartAngle for the StartAngle to be used.

remarks.para: The StartAngle will always be between 0 degrees and 360 degrees.

The StartAngle will always specify the start angle according to a counterclockwise polar circle, with 0 degrees being at the right edge of the polar circle, 90 degrees at top of circle, 180 degrees at left of circle, 270 degrees at bottom of circle, and so forth.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.GridLineStartRadius
member.summary: Sets and gets the starting radius for the grid lines.

remarks.para: One can limit the grid lines to only a certain range of the axis by assigning the GridLineStartRadius and GridLineEndRadius.
Note that if both GridLineStartRadius = -1 and GridLineEndRadius = -1 (their default values), then the grid lines will be drawn as normal, spanning the entire axis range.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisAngular.GridLineEndRadius
member.summary: Sets and gets the ending radius for the grid lines.

remarks.para: One can limit the grid lines to only a certain range of the axis by assigning the GridLineStartRadius and GridLineEndRadius.
Note that if both GridLineStartRadius = -1 and GridLineEndRadius = -1 (their default values), then the grid lines will be drawn as normal, spanning the entire axis range.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisPositionType
member.summary: Specifies the location of a linear axis.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisPositionType.Variable
member.summary: The axis tries to draw itself through the origin point (0,0). If the origin point does not exist in the range of data graphed, then the axis positions itself close to the origin point. For example, if the Y values for a chart go from -5 to -20, then a variable-mode X axis displays at the top of the chart.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisPositionType.Left
member.summary: A vertical axis displays on the left side of the chart. A horizontal axis displays on the bottom.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisPositionType.Right
member.summary: A vertical axis displays on the right side of the chart. A horizontal axis displays on the top.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisPositionType.Top
member.summary: A horizontal axis displays on the top of the chart. A vertical axis displays on the right.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisPositionType.Bottom
member.summary: A horizontal axis displays on the bottom of the chart. A vertical axis displays on the left.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PolarAxisPositionType
member.summary: Specifies axis position for Radial, Angular, Radar and Pie charts.

remarks.para: For a Radial axis, this enumeration defines the position where the axis draws. For Angular and Pie axes, it defines the starting position, the place where the minimum value is drawn.

para.para: For example, for a Radial axis, Left means the axis draws from the center to the left. For a Radar axis, Left defines the starting position for the first data point's spoke.

remarks.para: If UseStartAngle is specified, then the property will be used instead of the StartPosition.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PolarAxisPositionType.Left
member.summary: Left

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PolarAxisPositionType.Right
member.summary: Right

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PolarAxisPositionType.Top
member.summary: Top

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PolarAxisPositionType.Bottom
member.summary: Bottom

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PolarAxisPositionType.UseStartAngle
member.summary: UseStartAngle

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisScaleType
member.summary: Specifies where and how an axis obtains the value range for the axis.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisScaleType.ZeroOrigin
member.summary: The axis always displays zero within the axis range. For example, if a data series goes from 300 to 900, the axis displays a range from 0 to 900.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisScaleType.BestFit
member.summary: Use the min and max values across all of the series that display on the axis. For example, if there are three series displaying on an axis, and the min/max values are 300 and 900, then the axis displays a range from 300 to 900.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisScaleType.UserDefined
member.summary: Display an axis range defined by the user. The axis object has MaxAxisValueUser and MinAxisValueUser properties exposed for this purpose.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisScaleType.AutoRound
member.summary:
Display an axis range from a round minimum value to a round maximum value. For example, if the max data value is 97, the maximum axis value is set to 100.
Note that AutoRound produces a different result depending on whether the axis is using MajorTickCount or MajorTickInterval. In either case, there is always a tick mark at the minimum value on the axis and a tick mark at the maximum value.
When AutoRound is active, the TickMode setting is ignored and forced to the OnStartAtMinValue setting. This ensures a tick mark will draw and the min and max values on the axis will be as described above.
For Radial and Angular axes, the AutoRound setting produces the same results as the ZeroOrigin setting.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisScaleType.SmartScaling
member.summary: Displays an axis with each axis tick or axis label containing mostly zeros. An example would be a tick or label of 150000 rather than 147652. This works quite similar to AutoRound, but produces labels that more consistenly contain mostly zeros.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TickDrawStyle
member.summary: Specifies how the tick marks paint.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TickDrawStyle.ThroughAxis
member.summary: Draws the tick marks through the axis such that they display on both sides of the axis.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TickDrawStyle.InsideAxis
member.summary: Draws the tick marks on the inside of the axis only. Note that if an axis is moved to the opposite side of the chart, the direction of the tick marks does not reverse.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TickDrawStyle.OutsideAxis
member.summary: Draws the tick marks on the outside of the axis only. Note that if an axis is moved to the opposite side of the chart, the direction of the tick marks does not reverse.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TickMode
member.summary: Specifies whether tick marks are turned off or turned on. Note there are two modes for ticks when they are turned on.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TickMode.Off
member.summary: Tick marks do not display.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TickMode.OnStartAtZero
member.summary: Tick marks display and numbering starts at zero whether going in the negative direction or the positive direction. If zero does not appear in the axis range, then numbering still starts at zero. The visual effect of this may be that no major tick mark appears at the start of the axis.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TickMode.OnStartAtMinValue
member.summary: Tick marks display and numbering starts at the smallest number on the axis. The visual effect of this is that there is always a major tick mark at the start of the axis. Note that if zero is in the axis range, it may not display a tick mark in this mode.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AngularUnits
member.summary: Specifies the unit of measurement to use for an Angular axis.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AngularUnits.Degrees
member.summary: Degrees

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AngularUnits.Radians
member.summary: Radians

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.RotationDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction of rotation for Angular and Pie axes.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.RotationDirection.Clockwise
member.summary: Clockwise

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.RotationDirection.CounterClockwise
member.summary: Counterclockwise

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PieUnits
member.summary: Specifies the value to display in labels for pie wedges when marker labels are visible.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PieUnits.Value
member.summary: Display the actual numeric value represented by the wedge.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PieUnits.Percent
member.summary: Display the wedge's percentage of the pie.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PieLabelLocation
member.summary: Specifies where pie labels draw.
member.remarks:
Smart pie labels use the property. to determine how far from the pie the labels will be offset. The property is used to determine where the label line will bend.
The smart label mechanism will paint the pie labels on both the left and right sides of the pie. To make more space available for the labels you can manipulate the Grid margin properties (e.g. , ). Or you can use the property to shrink the size of the pie.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PieLabelLocation.Inside
member.summary: Pie labels paint inside the pie wedges.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PieLabelLocation.Outside
member.summary: Pie labels paint outside the pie wedges.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.PieLabelLocation.SmartLabels
member.summary: Pie labels aligned on left and right of pie, so as not to overlap each other. See remarks for more information.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisMode
member.summary: Specifies the numeric mode for an axis.
member.remarks: Note that some modes may not be valid for certain chart types. Refer to the ChartType documentation.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisMode.Category
member.summary:
Values on the axis are not quantitative but are instead used only for identification (e.g., point 1, point 2, point 3). The order of values has no significance.
The MajorTickInterval property for a category-based axis should be set to 1 for best results.
Category mode does not have any effect on a Radar chart.

summary.para: Values on the axis are dates. The order of values is chronological.
When an axis is in date mode, the Series data graphed on the axis must contain date data.
Date mode does not have any effect on the Radar chart.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisMode.ValueLinear
member.summary: Values on the axis are numeric and the scale is linear.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisMode.ValueLog
member.summary: Values on the axis are numeric and the scale is logarithmic.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GridLineType
member.summary: Specifies the type of grid lines for a Radar chart.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GridLineType.Circle
member.summary: Drawn as circles when grid lines are enabled.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GridLineType.Polygon
member.summary: Drawn as polygons when grid lines are enabled.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel
member.summary: Provides the axis for a funnel chart.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an instance of this type.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.GetTotalDataPoints
member.summary:
Return the total number of data points within the series containing the funnel data.
Note that this number does NOT reflect how many data points are currently displaying on the axis.
member.returns: Number of data points.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.GetActiveMaxValue
member.summary: The active max axis value is the value that the axis system is currently using to caculate the percent fill for each funnel marker. This value will either be the calculated max value, or if the MaxAxisValueUser property is non zero then this value will be the value from the MaxAxisValueUser.
member.returns: A double representing the active max value.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.GetCalculatedMaxValue
member.summary: The calculated max value is assigned internally when the axis is reconciled against the series data attached to the chart. This value is the max value returned by the data provided attached to the Y component within the series.
member.returns: A double representing the calculated max value.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.MaxAxisValueUser
member.summary: Sets and gets a user-defined maximum axis value.

remarks.para: Note that if MaxAxisValueUser is zero, the calculated max value is used.

The funnel segments (i.e. funnel markers) fill themselves based on the maximum funnel axis value and the segment value. In other words, the fill is the percentage of the segment value to the axis maximum value.

The funnel axis calculates a maximum axis value by calling the attached series, which in turn talk to the corresponding data provider to return the maximum value within the data. This calculated maximum value is used as the default maximum value unless overridden via this property by setting the value to someting other than zero.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.SmallEndSizePercent
member.summary: Sets and gets a value between 0 and 100, representing the size of the small end of the funnel as a percentage of the size of the large end of the funnel.
member.remarks: The size of the large end of the funnel is determined by the grid property and the grid property.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.LabelsEnabled
member.summary: Sets and gets the boolean that turns funnel bottom labels on and off.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.ArcWidth
member.summary: Sets and gets the value that controls the curve of the funnel.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.FunnelFill
member.summary: Gets the Background object that provides the background for the main funnel area.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.FunnelEndFill
member.summary: Gets the Background object that fills the large end of the funnel area.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisFunnel.LabelFormatMaskPercentFill
member.summary: Sets and gets the mask for formatting marker labels showing the percent fill of each sement.
member.remarks: This property accepts any valid .NET format string that is accepted by the ToString() method. See the .NET documentation for more information.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisPie
member.summary: Pie axis. This axis is never drawn but does contain several properties that effect how a Pie chart is displayed.

member.summary: Defines the starting position of the first pie slice. See the enum for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisPie.Direction
member.summary: Defines which direction the the pie slices will display around the pie.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar
member.summary: This is the radial axis for radar charts.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an instance of this type.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.SpokeLabelOffset
member.summary: Sets and gets the offset the offset of the spoke labels from the end of each radar spoke.
member.remarks: There is no upper limit to this value but if the value is large enough, the labels will paint outside the grid area and hence not be visible.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.ReverseValues
member.remarks: Setting this property to true reverses the values on the axis system such that the larger max axis value is at the origin of the radar graph and the smaller min axis value is at the end of the radar graph.
member.summary: Reverses the order of values on the axis.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.AxisPosition
member.summary: Defines the position where the first datapoint spoke starts.
member.remarks: Note that this value is also used for the Polar chart type but is used slightly differently in that chart type. See the enumeration for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.AxisScale
member.summary: Defines where and how an axis obtains the value range for the axis.
member.remarks: See the enumeration for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.MinAxisValueUser
member.summary: Sets and gets a user-defined minimum axis value.
member.remarks: Note that this value is not active until the AxisScale property is set to AxisScaleType.UserDefined.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.MaxAxisValueUser
member.summary: Sets and gets a user-defined maximum axis value.
member.remarks: Note that this value is not active until the AxisScale property is set to AxisScaleType.UserDefined.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.MajorTickInterval
member.summary: Sets and gets the interval between major tick marks.
member.remarks: If the tick interval is set such that greater than 500 major tick marks are required to draw, the engine will ignore this setting and default to displaying only 10 major ticks. This is a safety value to prevent the system from trying to draw an impossibly large number of tick marks.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.MajorTickCount
member.summary: Sets and gets the total number of major ticks to display.
member.remarks:
This property guarantees the axis will always start and end with a major tick mark.
This property is mutually exclusive with the MajorTickInterval property. If both properties are set, the MajorTickCount property is used.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.MinorTicks
member.summary: Sets and gets the number of minor ticks to display between each major tick.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.TickDrawStyle
member.summary: Determines how the tick marks are drawn. for more information.
member.remarks: For example, tick marks can draw through the axis, above the axis, or below the axis. See the enumeration.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.TickMode
member.summary: Turns tick drawing on and off.
member.remarks: See the enumeration for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.GridLineType
member.summary: Determines whether to draw grid lines as circles or polygons.
member.remarks: See the enumeration for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.TickSize
member.summary: Sets and gets the size of the tick marks.
member.remarks: Minor ticks marks are always half the size of the major tick marks.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisRadar.RotationDirection
member.summary: Defines which direction the radar spokes will display around the graph from the AxisPosition starting point.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase
member.summary: AxisTypeListBase is the base class for all axis lists, including AxisYList, AxisXList, AxisYPrimeList, AxisXPrimeList.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.Add(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a new axis to the axis list.
member.returns: The index of the new axis.
member.remarks: Axis spacing is automatically adjusted when a new axis is added if the AutoArrange property is set to true.
member.param: An AxisY axis to add to the list.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes an axis from the axis list.
member.remarks: The object passed in should be type AxisBase, or a derivative.
member.param: The AxisBase object to remove from the AxisTypeList.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.UpdateMapping
member.summary: Updates all Series Drawing mapping to the axis list.
member.remarks: This method verifies that each SeriesDrawing object maps to a valid instantiated Axis object in the Axis list.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.Clear
member.summary: Removes all elements from the list

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.ClearAllMapping
member.summary: Clears all axis list mapping from within the SeriesDrawing list.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.ArrangeEvenly
member.summary: Arranges all axes so that they are evenly spaced within the grid margin.
member.remarks: This method achieves even spacing by setting the Offset property of each axis. The setting is calculated by dividing the size of the grid margin by the number of axes in the list plus one.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.GetAxis(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an axis whose Name property matches the specified string.
member.remarks: This method searches the axes in the chart's axis list and returns the first one that contains the specified string in its Name property.
member.returns: Axis object or null if not found.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.GetAxis(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves an axis at the specified index.
member.returns: Axis object or null if no axis exists at the specified index.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.WriteProperties(System.Xml.XmlDocument,GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags,System.String)
member.summary: Writes all the axis objects currently in the list out to XML.
member.param: The XmlDocument context used to create the new element node.
Template flags to control template writing. See .
The name that will be given to the element node.
member.returns: This method returns an XmlElement if properties were written. A null value is returned if there were no properties to write.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.ReadProperties(System.Xml.XmlNode,GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags)
member.summary: Reads axis objects from the xml node and rebuilds the SpecialEffectsList.
member.param: XmlNode that contains the properties.
Template flags to control template writing. See .

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.AutoArrange
member.summary: Controls whether axes in the list are automatically arranged so that each axis is evenly spaced within the grid margin.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true (the default), axes are automatically spaced evenly within the grid margin. The control achieves even spacing by dividing the number of axes plus one into the size of the margin and then setting the result in the Offset property of each axis.
If you want to determine axis spacing manually, set AutoArrange to false before setting the Offset properties of axes in the list.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListBase.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an axis whose Name property matches the specified string.
member.remarks: This method searches the axes in the chart's axis list and returns the first one that contains the specified string in its Name property.
member.returns: Axis object or null if not found.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisTypeListHelper
member.summary: AxisTypeListHelper will assist in producing all the extra axis lists, such as AxisYList, AxisYPrimeList, AxisXList, AxisXPrimeList.

member.remarks: Valid values range from 0 to 100 (a percentage). This is the gap on either side of a set of bars within an interval.

member.remarks: Valid values range from 0 to 100. This is the percentage that each bar overlaps the previous one.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisX.IsOverlappedFirstOnTop
member.remarks: If the value is true, then the first bar is on top and the rest cascade underneath. If false, then the last bar is on top and they cascade in the other direction.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisX.IsPareto
member.remarks: Setting this property to true sorts data points in descending order of the values of the X components in the first series added to the chart. Note that each time this value is set to true the existing set of sorted data points is cleared and then recreated.
member.summary: Determines whether X component data values are sorted in descending order.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisY
member.summary: Supports the Y axis on two-dimensional linear charts.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisY.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an instance of this type.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisYList
member.summary: Allows for as many 2D Y axes as desired, in addition to the main Y axis available through Grid.AxisY.

remarks.para:
To use the AxisYList, create a new AxisY object, add it to the AxisYList, and then map a series to the new AxisY object by using the
property.
Note that all the Y axes will be drawn within the grid margins: or .

example.para: The following example is from code that creates a chart comparing data for apple production in four regions with data for sunshine and rainfall in each region. On the chart, each data set maps to a different Y axis.
The fragment below creates three data series and two additional Y axes. The first data series is mapped to the main Y axis and each of the two remaining series is mapped to an axis in the AxisYList.
example.code:
Imports GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting Imports GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData
Private Sub Form1_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load
' ' Create three data series using the array ' data provider. '
' load data in arrays Dim arraySun() As Double = {350, 330, 225, 300} 'days annually Dim arrayRain() As Double = {8, 20, 30, 8} 'inches annually Dim arrayApples() As Double = {660, 604, 580, 788} 'bushels per acre
' create data providers Dim provSun As ArrayDataProvider = New ArrayDataProvider(arraySun) Dim provRain As ArrayDataProvider = New ArrayDataProvider(arrayRain) Dim provApples As ArrayDataProvider = New ArrayDataProvider(arrayApples)
' create Sun series Dim serSun As Series = New Series serSun.SeriesName = "Days of Sun" serSun.BindComponent(SeriesComponent.Y, provSun, String.Empty)
' create Rain series Dim serRain As Series = New Series serRain.SeriesName = "Inches of Rain" serRain.BindComponent(SeriesComponent.Y, provRain, String.Empty)
' create Apples series Dim serApples As Series = New Series serApples.SeriesName = "Bushels per Acre" serApples.BindComponent(SeriesComponent.Y, provApples, String.Empty)
' create label series for X axis Dim serLabels As Series = New Series serLabels.SetValue(SeriesComponent.Label, 0, "Argentina") serLabels.SetValue(SeriesComponent.Label, 1, "Chile") serLabels.SetValue(SeriesComponent.Label, 2, "New Zealand") serLabels.SetValue(SeriesComponent.Label, 3, "Yakima")
' ' Load data in the chart ' Dim chart As Chart = Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart
' remove old data chart.RemoveAllSeries()
' add new series Dim indexSun As Integer = chart.AddSeries(serSun) ' capture index for later use Dim indexRain As Integer = chart.AddSeries(serRain) Dim indexApples As Integer = chart.AddSeries(serApples)
' label X axis chart.Grid.AxisX.LabelSeries = serLabels
' ' Format primary Y axis for apple data ' chart.Grid.AxisY.Color = chart.GetSeriesDrawing(indexApples).MarkerFill.Color chart.Grid.AxisY.LabelProperties.Color = chart.Grid.AxisY.Color
' scale the axis chart.Grid.AxisY.AxisScale = AxisScaleType.UserDefined chart.Grid.AxisY.MaxAxisValueUser = 800 chart.Grid.AxisY.MinAxisValueUser = 550 chart.Grid.AxisY.MajorTickCount = 0 chart.Grid.AxisY.MajorTickInterval = 50
' map apple series to axis chart.GetSeriesDrawing(indexApples).MapToYList = -1
' Create two additional Y axes for sun and rain data. ' Set the color to match the marker color for each series. ' Set a tick interval appropriate for data. ' Map the corresponding series drawing to the axis. ' chart.Grid.MarginAxisLeft = 150 ' make room for additional axes chart.Grid.AxisYList.Clear() ' remove any existing axes from the list chart.Grid.AxisYList.AutoArrange = True ' let GS arrange the axes
' create axis for rainfall data Dim axisRain As AxisY = New AxisY axisRain.Color = chart.GetSeriesDrawing(indexRain).MarkerFill.Color axisRain.LabelProperties.Color = axisRain.Color
' scale the axis axisRain.AxisScale = AxisScaleType.UserDefined axisRain.MaxAxisValueUser = 35 axisRain.MinAxisValueUser = 5 axisRain.MajorTickCount = 0 axisRain.MajorTickInterval = 5
' map rainfall series to axis chart.GetSeriesDrawing(indexRain).MapToYList = chart.Grid.AxisYList.Add(axisRain)
' create axis for sun data Dim axisSun As AxisY = New AxisY axisSun.Color = chart.GetSeriesDrawing(indexSun).MarkerFill.Color axisSun.LabelProperties.Color = axisSun.Color
' scale the axis axisSun.AxisScale = AxisScaleType.UserDefined axisSun.MaxAxisValueUser = 360 axisSun.MinAxisValueUser = 120 axisSun.MajorTickCount = 0 axisSun.MajorTickInterval = 40
' map sunshine series to axis chart.GetSeriesDrawing(indexSun).MapToYList = chart.Grid.AxisYList.Add(axisSun)
' redraw the chart chart.RecalcLayout()
End Sub

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisYList.ArrangeEvenly
member.summary: Arranges all axes so that they are evenly spaced within the grid margin.
member.remarks: This method achieves even spacing by setting the Offset property of each axis. The setting is calculated by dividing the size of the left or right grid margin (depending on the setting of AxisY.AxisPosition) by the number of axes in the list plus one.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.AxisYPrime
member.summary: Supports a secondary Y axis on two-dimensional linear charts.

remarks.para: A secondary Y axis is useful when two or more data series use different units of measurement or have widely different ranges of value.

By default, the Y axis and the Y prime axis are on opposite sides of the chart, with the Y axis on the left, and the Y prime axis on the right. You can change the position of either axis by setting its AxisPosition property. If you choose to position both axes on the same side, they will overwrite one another unless you also set the Offset property of one axis to a value large enough to move the axis, its tick marks, and its labels into the grid margin. You might also need to increase the size of the margin by setting the Grid object's MarginAxisLeft or MarginAxisRight property.

The key to using the Y prime axis lies in mapping data to it. By default, the Y component data of all data series map to the Y axis. To map a particular data series to the Y prime axis rather than the Y axis, you must set the MapToYPrime property of that data series' SeriesDrawing object. The Y prime axis does not display until at least one SeriesDrawing object's MapToYPrime property is set to true.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.IAxisLabelGenerator
member.summary: IAxisLabelGenerator interface allows developers to build custom label generator objects and attach these objects to any chart Axis via the property.
member.remarks:
When an axis label generator object is attach to an axis that object is responsible for generating an axis label for any value passed in via the
interface method.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.IAxisLabelGenerator.GenerateLabel(System.Double)
member.summary: GenerateLabel can either return a string that represents the label for the passed in value or it can return null to indicate it is not interested in generating a label for that value. If null is returned then the the axis will continue it's search for a label via other mechanisms.
member.param: The value of the tick mark that requires an axis label.
member.returns: Returns a string if the value was converted to a label, otherwise null.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.IMajorTickGenerator
member.summary: The IMajorTickGenerator interface allows developers to build custom tick generator objects and attach these objects to any chart Axis via the property.
member.remarks: The property takes precedence over both the and the properties. The MajorTickCount and MajorTickInterval will only be used if MajorTickGenerator has not be set (i.e. when MajorTickGenerator = null).

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Background.BackgroundType
member.summary: Determines the fill mode of the background object (ie gradient, image, pattern, etc). Refer to the enum for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Background.Transparency
member.summary: Specifies the transparency of the background. A 0% transparency is opaque and 100 is completely transparent.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Background.Color
member.summary: Specifies the color used for the background when the background type is simple.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Background.ImageFile
member.summary: Specifies the name of the image file to use for an image type background. This file name can be an absolute path, a relative path or a UNC path. See remarks for more information.
member.remarks:
For window forms a relative paths, UNC paths and absolute paths can also be used for the file name. Note however that relative paths will work differently in design-time versus run-time. In design-time the relative path (e.g. images\MyImage.jpg) is relative to the main appliation folder (e.g c:\MyApplication\images\MyImage.jpg). At run-time the relative path is is relative to directory where the exe resides (e.g c:\MyApplication\bin\release\images\MyImage.jpg).
For web forms use only an absolute path or a UNC path. Relative paths work when in design-time but during run-time the relative path can not be resolved properly.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Background.ImageEmbeddedEnabled
member.summary: Specifies the if the ImageFile to use for an image type background is embedded inside an Assembly or a DLL. One also must set the ImageEmbeddedAssembly for the embedded image to function properly.
member.remarks: Note the ImageFile name must include the full namespace, such as using GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Background.BackgroundImage.Clouds.jpg for our GSNetWin.DLL assembly. The ImageFile string is also case sensitive.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Background.ImageEmbeddedAssembly
member.summary: Specifies which Assembly or DLL to use for an ImageFile that is embedded within the Assembly or DLL. One also must set the ImageFileEmbedded to true for the embedded image to function properly.
member.remarks: Note the ImageFile name must include the full namespace, such as using GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Background.BackgroundImage.Clouds.jpg for our GSNetWin.DLL assembly. The ImageFile string is also case sensitive.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Background.Position

For window forms a relative paths, UNC paths and absolute paths can also be used for the file name. Note however that relative paths will work differently in design-time versus run-time. In design-time the relative path (e.g. images\MyImage.jpg) is relative to the main appliation folder (e.g c:\MyApplication\images\MyImage.jpg). At run-time the relative path is is relative to directory where the exe resides (e.g c:\MyApplication\bin\release\images\MyImage.jpg).
For web forms use only an absolute path or a UNC path. Relative paths work when in design-time but during run-time the relative path can not be resolved properly.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BackgroundType
member.summary: The background object supports several different types of background fill modes. This enum allows the user to specify a background fill mode.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BackgroundType.Simple
member.summary: The simple mode fills the background with a single solid color.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BackgroundType.Gradient
member.summary: The gradient mode fills the background based on two selected colors and a gradient style.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BackgroundType.Image
member.summary: The image mode fills the background with a selected image file.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BackgroundType.Texture
member.summary: The texture mode fills the background with a selected image file. Note that this image file is used as a texture so the image is non-stretched and repeated over and over.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BackgroundType.Pattern
member.summary: The pattern mode fills the background with a pattern type. The color of the pattern is based on the selection of two pattern colors.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GradientType
member.summary: These are all the valid gradient types in the system.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GradientType.VerticalBottomUp
member.summary: Vertically from the bottom to the top.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GradientType.VerticalTopDown
member.summary: Vertically from the top to the bottom.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GradientType.VerticalMiddleOut
member.summary: Vertically from the middle to the top and bottom.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BorderOutline
member.summary: The border outline object creates visual effects that can surround a widget Meter device.
member.remarks: All EdgeEffectTypes are supported, and all the BorderTypes are supported.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BorderOutline.#ctor
member.summary: constructor

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BorderOutline.Paint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Paints the border based on the current border settings.
member.param: PaintEventArgs
Upper-left corner of the border.
Width and height of the rectangle the border will paint around.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BorderOutline.Padding
member.summary: Sets or gets the amount of padding, or space, between the BorderOutline and the object it surrounds.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.BorderOutline.Tension
member.summary: Sets or gets the tension of the curve drawn when generating the border outline.
member.remarks: The tension setting is not always used. It is used in cases such as Meter objects that have ScaleLabelsOn set to true.The tension value should be between 0 and 1. A tension of 0 forces the curve to take the shortest way (a straight line) between points. A value of 1 forces the curve to take a path with the least amount of bend. A value larger than 1 will produce a curve modeling the behavior of a compressed spring. For a discussion of spline tension, see the article on "Cardinal Splines" in the .NET Framework Developer's Guide.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Cage
member.summary: The Cage object contains properties to manipulate the appearance of 3D charts. The cage can be thought of as a room with 6 walls that completely surrounds a 3D chart. Each wall can be turned on or off. Each wall can have a different interior and exterior fill. The whole cage, along with the 3D chart can be rotated in the x, y and/or z directions.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Cage.WallBottom
member.summary: Properties for the cage's bottom wall. Applies to 3D charts only. See the object for more information.

member.summary: Properties for the cage's top wall. Applies to 3D charts only. See the object for more information.

member.summary: This property is a Line object that controls how the edges of the cage are drawn. See the Object for detailed information about Line properties.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ErrorBar.SetDataPointMinusError(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.remarks: When the error bar type has been set to user-defined, this method is used to build the list of user-defined errors for the negative direction of the error bar. For each data point that requires a user defined error in the negative direction, call this method with the data point and the error amount.
member.summary: Sets a user-defined error for the negative direction.

member.summary: Gets and sets the width of the cross bar on error bars.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ErrorBar.FixedValue
member.summary: Gets and sets the fixed value for error bars drawn when the ErrorBarType property is set to fixed value type.
member.remarks: Error bars are drawn so that arms extend in the positive and negative directions from a data point. When ErrorBarType is FixedValue, the FixedValue property specifies the length of the arms.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ErrorBar.DisplayPlusBar
member.summary: Controls whether error bars are drawn in the positive direction.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ErrorBar.DisplayMinusBar
member.summary: Controls whether error bars are drawn in the negative direction.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ErrorBar.Percent
member.summary: Gets and sets the percentage value for error bars drawn when the ErrorBarType property is set to percent type.
member.remarks: Error bars are drawn so that arms extend in the positive and negative directions from a data point. When ErrorBarType is Percent, the Percent property specifies the length of the arms. Note that a percentage is taken from each data value, so the lengths of error bars vary for each data point.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ErrorBar.NumberOfStdDev
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of standard deviations to use for error bars drawn when the ErrorBarType property is set to standard deviation type.
member.remarks: Error bars are drawn so that arms extend in the positive and negative directions from a data point. When ErrorBarType is StandardDeviation, the NumberOfStdDev property specifies the length of the arms. The length of each arm is NumberOfStdDev standard deviations from the mean for the data series.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Grid.FindMarkSymbolPoint(GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.SeriesDrawing,System.Int32)
member.summary: Find the symbol point for the specified data point in the specified series.
member.remarks:
This routine will search through all the marker drawing objects and find the corresponding marker for the specified parameters. The symbol point will then be retrieved from that marker and returned
If the marker cannot be found then the point (0,0) will be returned. Note that this point will be in grid coordinates.
member.returns: The return value is a Grid coordinate representing the symbol point for the specified data point in the specified series.
member.param: Zero-based data point index.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Grid.BorderLabelList
member.summary: Gets the BorderLabelList object that contains the BorderLabel objects currently attached to the grid. This property exists to provide access to the properties and methods of the underlying BorderLabelList object.

example.code:
'Create a label for the bottom of the grid Dim labelBottom As BorderLabel = New BorderLabel labelBottom.Text = "X Axis" labelBottom.RelativeLocation = RelativeLocation.BottomMiddle labelBottom.OffsetTopBottom = 0
'Create a label for the left side of the grid Dim labelLeft As BorderLabel = New BorderLabel labelLeft.Text = "Y Axis" labelLeft.RelativeLocation = RelativeLocation.LeftMiddle labelLeft.OffsetTopBottom = 0
With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart 'Add the border labels to the grid .Grid.BorderLabelList.Add(labelBottom) .Grid.BorderLabelList.Add(labelLeft) End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Grid.StartDataPoint
member.summary: Get or set the index of the beginning data point in a range.
member.remarks: The start data point and end data point properties allow the user to specify a range of data points to display in the chart. This range is independent of any specific SeriesDrawing object (i.e. it applies across all series that have been added to the chart). The data point range is ignored if either the start or end data point property is less than zero (data points are zero based).

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Grid.EndDataPoint
member.summary: Get or set the index of the ending data point in a range.
member.remarks: The start data point and end data point properties allow the user to specify a range of data points to display in the chart. This range is independent of any specific SeriesDrawing object (i.e. it applies across all series that have been added to the chart). The data point range is ignored if either the start or end data point property is less than zero (data points are zero based).

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Projection
member.summary: Specifies the type of projection to use for a 3D chart.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Projection.Axonometric
member.summary: Also known as parallel perspective, axonometric projection tries to remain true to scale rather than be visually realistic.
member.remarks: With axonometric projection, lines that are parallel along the Z axis in 3-dimensional space remain parallel in the 2-dimensional picture. There is no vanishing point; objects do not get smaller as they move away from the viewer. If you know the scale of the axes, you can measure the width, height, length, and depth of an object directly from the picture -- hence the name axonometric.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Projection.Perspective
member.summary: Also known as linear perspective, this type of projection tries to achieve visual realism when projecting 3-dimensional space onto a 2-dimensional picture.
member.remarks: With perspective projection, lines that are parallel along the Z axis in 3-dimensional space collapse to a vanishing point located on the horizon of the 2-dimensional picture. Objects get smaller as they move away from the viewer toward the vanishing point.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend
member.summary: Represents the legend for the chart.

remarks.para: The Legend class encapsulates all the functionality of the Chart control's legend, and is exposed through the Chart object's Legend property.
A chart can have only one legend.

The legend consists of an item for each series currently shown on the chart. Each item in the legend has a symbol corresponding to a data series on the chart and text taken, by default, from the corresponding SeriesName property.
Legends can:

list.item: Be sized and positioned anywhere in the chart's drawing area.
Be anchored to one or more edges of the chart.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.TextFormat
member.summary: Contains a TextPainter object that controls the display of text in the legend.
member.remarks: Refer to the object for details.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.BoxSize
member.summary: Defines the size of the symbol (icon or box) for all legend items.
member.remarks: Note that whether the box is displayed or not is controlled by the BoxMode property.

example.code:
Dim cht As Chart = Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart
' Format symbols cht.Legend.BoxMode = LegendBoxMode.BoxesOn cht.Legend.BoxSize = New System.Drawing.Size(15, 15)

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.BoxMode
member.summary: Controls whether legend items display icons or boxes or no symbol at all.
member.remarks: See the enumeration.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.BoxAlignment
member.summary: Controls how symbols are aligned with the text of legend items.
member.remarks: See the enumeration.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.NumberOfColumns
member.summary: Determines the number of columns in which legend items are arranged.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.DisplayHorizontal
member.summary: Controls whether legend items display horizontally in one row.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.ReverseOrder
member.summary: Controls whether legend items are listed in reverse order.

remarks.para: By default, legend items are listed in the same order that data series are listed in the SeriesDrawingList. (Usually this is the order in which the series were added.) Setting ReverseOrder to true lists items in reverse of their order in the SeriesDrawingList.
This property can be useful if you want to arrange legend items in the same order as series are drawn in a stacked bar chart (first series on the bottom, last series on top).

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.IconOutlineEnabled
member.summary: Controls whether outlines are drawn around legend symbols.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.MarginLeft
member.summary: Defines the left margin within the legend object's drawing area.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.MarginRight
member.summary: Defines the right margin within the legend object's drawing area.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.MarginTop
member.summary: Defines the top margin within the legend object's drawing area.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.MarginBottom
member.summary: Defines the bottom margin within the legend object's drawing area.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Legend.AutoTextColor
member.summary: Controls whether legend text is automatically colored to match the series.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true uses the same color for legend item text as is used by the corresponding series on the chart. Setting it to false uses the color specified in the TextPainter object accessed through the TextFormat property.
member.summary: Controls the color of text in legend items.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.LegendBoxAlignment
member.summary: Legend items consist of two pieces. One piece is the box (or icon) and the second piece is the text. This enumeration defines how these two pieces display with regards to one another if the box is not turned off. For example, a LeftCenter alignment means the box will display to the left of the text and the box will be horizontally center aligned to the text.

member.summary: Centered horizontally above the text.

member.summary: Centered vertically to the right of the text.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ILineCondition
member.summary: ILineCondition interface contains properties and methods for supporting the conditional line properties concept. Developers can build custom line condition classes by implementing this interface.

remarks.para: This is similar to the interface but applied to line properties instead of marker backgrounds.
One can use the ILineCondition to color portions of a line differently depending on if the developer-defined conditions are met for those portions of the line.

member.example: See the example available in the method.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ILineCondition.CheckCondition(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the value(s) of each data point against the criteria of the line condition.
member.remarks: CheckCondition is called for each data point within the SeriesDrawing object with which the line condition object is associated. CheckCondition should return true if the data point passes the criteria of the check. If there are multiple line condition objects associated to a SeriesDrawing object, then the data point is passed into each object starting at the front of the line condition object list. Once one of the line condition objects returns true, the check is halted for that data point.
member.param: The Series that contains the data that will be checked.
This integer defines which data point within the series holds the data values to check.
member.returns: True if the data point passes the line condition object's criteria.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ILineCondition.Name
member.summary: This property is the name of the line condition.
member.remarks: Although it is not necessary to name line conditions, names may be useful for searching and finding specific line condition objects later.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ILineCondition.Line
member.summary: Gets or sets the Line properties used to paint a line when its value(s) meet the criteria of the line condition.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.MarkerConditionBase
member.summary: This base class implements the interface and provides a quick and easy means of creating custom marker condition objects.
member.remarks:
Marker condition objects are used by instantiating the object, setting the object's criteria and then associating the marker condition object to a object or multiple SeriesDrawing object in a chart. After all the marker condition objects have been created and associated the method is called to execute the tests.
A marker condition object can be associated to a SeriesDrawing class by call the method. The SeriesDrawing class also provides other methods like ,
and .

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.IMarkerCondition
member.summary: IMarkerCondition interface contains properties and methods for supporting the conditional marker fill concept. Developers can build custom marker condition classes by implementing this interface.
member.remarks:
Note that a base class exists in the library that already implements this interface. (See .) This class can be used as a base class when creating custom marker condition classes versus directly implementing the IMarkerCondition interface.
For additional information regarding the use of marker condition objects see the class.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.IMarkerCondition.CheckCondition(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series,System.Int32,GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.MarkerType)
member.summary: Checks the value(s) of each data point against the criteria of the marker condition.
member.remarks: CheckCondition is called for each data point within the SeriesDrawing object with which the marker condition object is associated. CheckCondition should return true if the data point passes the criteria of the check. If there are multiple marker condition objects associated to a SeriesDrawing object, then the data point is passed into each object starting at the front of the marker condition object list. Once one of the marker condition objects returns true, the check is halted for that data point.
member.param: The Series that contains the data that will be checked.
This int defines which data point within the series holds the data values to check.
This is the MarkerType used to draw the series. The check may need to access data from a different SeriesComponent within the series based on the MarkerType.
member.returns: True if the data point passes the marker condition object's criteria.
