member.param: Defines the relative location and size for the chart objects.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.DisplayChartPropertyWindow(System.Windows.Forms.UserControl)
member.summary: Displays a Properties window for the chart.
member.remarks: This method pops up the Chart Property window. Once this window is displayed, the chart properties can be modified interactively.
member.param: The owner of the chart.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.DisplayChartPropertySheet(System.Boolean,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Boolean,System.Windows.Forms.TabPage)
member.summary: Displays a chart property sheet dialog that includes a custom page.
member.remarks:
Not only does this method display the chart property sheet dialog, it also allows custom property pages to be added to the dialog. It is important to note that added custom property pages must be derived from the .Net TabPage object and must implement the IPropertyPage interface. An exception is thrown if the custom property page does not follow these rules.
Note that this method calls the InitPage method in the IPropertPage interface prior to adding the custom property page to the dialog.
member.exception: Custom property page does not implement the IPropertyPage interface.
member.param: Flag indicating whether to enable all property pages. This overrides the flags in the RunTimeProperties object.
This ArrayList contains all the custom pages to add to the dialog.
Set this value to true if the custom pages are to display before any of the standard pages that may be turned on.

This parameter can be null. If it is not null, then the specified property page will be the active page when the dialog displays. Note that this property page must also be in the extraPages ArrayList.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.DisplayChartPropertySheet(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Displays a chart property sheet dialog.
member.param: Flag indicating whether to enable all property pages. This overrides the flags in the RunTimeProperties object.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.GenerateQuickLayout
member.summary: Retrieves the current layout of the chart in QuickLayout format.
member.returns: A QuickLayoutData object for the current chart.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.SetRelativeLocation(GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.VisualChartObject,GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.VisualChartObject,GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.RelativeLocation)
member.summary: Changes one chart object's location in relation to another chart object.

code.title: Adding a title to the legend
Adding a title to the legend

example.code: ' Place an annotation along the bottom edge of the ' legend, where it can serve as the legend title Dim ann As Annotation = New Annotation With ann .Text = "Legend" .Size = New System.Drawing.Size(60, 20) .CoupleToEdge = CoupleToEdge.Top .CoupleToObject = CoupleToObject.Legend End With With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart .AnnotationList.Add(ann) .SetRelativeLocation(ann, .Legend, RelativeLocation.BottomMiddle) .SetRelativeLocation(.ChartTitle, .Grid, RelativeLocation.TopMiddle) End With

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.GetGridTopTitle
member.summary: Gets the annotation that is the top title for the grid.
member.returns: Annotation object. If no top title exists, then null is returned.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.SetGridTopTitle(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an annotation at the top edge of the grid.
member.returns: Annotation object. This allows one to change the annotation properties once the title has been created.

remarks.para: This method checks the chart's annotation collection for an Annotation object with the Name property set to "GridTopTitle." If such an object exists, the method sets its Text property with the specified string. If an annotation object named "GridTopTitle" does not exist, the method creates one. The method also:

list.item: sets the Annotation.Text property with the specified string
adds the annotation to the chart's annotation collection.

member.param: The text used for the Top Title.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.GetGridLeftTitle
member.summary: Gets the annotation that is the left title for the grid.
member.returns: Annotation object. If no Left Title exists, then null is returned.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.SetGridLeftTitle(System.String)

If such an object exists, the method sets its Text property with the specified string. If an annotation object named "GridLeftTitle" does not exist, the method creates one. The method also:

list.item: sets the Annotation.Text property with the specified string
adds the annotation to the chart's annotation collection.

member.returns: Annotation object. This allows one to change the annotation properties once the title has been created.

example.code:
' Add a left title Dim oLeftTitle As Annotation = Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart.SetGridLeftTitle("bushels")
' Format the title oLeftTitle.TextFormat.Font = New System.Drawing.Font("Myriad Condensed Web", 9, FontStyle.Bold) oLeftTitle.TextFormat.Color = Color.DarkSlateBlue

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.UnselectChartObject(System.Boolean)

member.remarks: Calling this method will unselect the currently selected chart object. If there are no currently selected chart object then this method will not do anything.
member.param: Set to true if you want a second selection change event to be sent out indicating that the Chart is now the selected object. This second event will go out after the first event which sends information about the object that is being unselected.

member.returns: Returns a true if selected object can be deleted.

member.summary: Expand the Designers object in the property window for access to the list of available designer forms.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.TemplateLoad
member.summary: Invokes a dialog box that allows the user to apply an existing template to the current chart.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.TemplateSave
member.summary: Invokes a dialog box that allows the user to save a chart as a template.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.GridTitles

member.remarks: At run time you can get and set grid titles using Chart object methods such as GetGridLeftTitle(), SetGridLeftTitle(), and so on.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.SeriesDefaults
member.summary: Gets the SeriesDefault object that is associated with the chart. This property exists to allow access to the properties and methods of the underlying SeriesDefault object.
member.remarks: When you add a Series object to a chart, it is wrapped in a SeriesDrawing object with properties and methods that control the visual display of data on a chart. Each new SeriesDrawing object inherits the settings of the SeriesDefaults object exposed by the chart's SeriesDefaults property.

example.code: //Specify a default setting for SeriesDrawing.MarkerLineThickness this.gsNetWinChart1.Chart.SeriesDefaults.MarkerLineThickness = 4;
'Specify a default setting for SeriesDrawing.MarkerLineThickness Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart.SeriesDefaults.MarkerLineThickness = 4

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ChartType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of chart used to represent the data.

remarks.para: This property controls which type of chart currently represents the data. For a list of supported chart types, see the ChartType enumeration.
Changing the setting for this property reconciles any existing SeriesDrawing objects and axes to conform to the selected chart type, and then redraws the chart.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.Background
member.summary: Gets the Background object that provides the background for the charting area. This property exists to provide access to the properties and methods of the underlying Background object.
member.remarks: Note that this property controls the main background for the chart. Each chart object, including the grid, legend, chart title, and any annotations, can have its own background. If you want the chart's main background to show through other objects, you must set the Background.Transparency properties of the other objects.

example.code: With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart 'Make chart objects transparent .ChartTitle.Background.Transparency = 100 .Grid.Background.Transparency = 100 .Legend.Background.Transparency = 100 'Give the chart a gradient background .Background.BackgroundType = BackgroundType.Gradient .Background.GradientStartColor = System.Drawing.Color.DeepSkyBlue .Background.GradientEndColor = System.Drawing.Color.MediumBlue End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.OleDBConnect
member.summary: Gets the OleDBConnect object associated with the chart. This property exists to provide access to the properties and methods of the underlying OleDBConnect object.
member.remarks: Set this property in the Properties window at design time to create a connection to an OleDb data source.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.Border
member.summary: Gets the Border object that controls the border around the chart. This property exists to provide access to the properties and methods of the underlying Border object.

code.title: Using the Border property to access the Border object
Using the Border property to access the Border object

example.code: 'Put a shadowed border around the chart drawing area With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart.Border .BorderType = BorderType.Simple .EdgeEffectType = EdgeEffectType.GradientDropShadow End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ChartTitle
member.summary: Gets the Title object that controls the main title for the chart. This property exists to provide access to the properties and methods of the underlying Title object.
member.remarks: In addition to the chart title, a chart can contain other text in the form of annotations, including annotations created by setting the GridTitles property.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.Grid
member.summary: Gets the Grid object that controls the area of the chart where the graph selected by the ChartType property is drawn. The Grid property exists to provide access to the properties and methods of the underlying Grid object.
member.remarks:
This property wraps a Grid object that provides the drawing surface for the graph, including axes, axis labels, tick marks, grid lines, limit lines, trend lines, error bars, data markers, and data labels.
By default, the Grid object clips all drawing so that it does not extend past Grid object boundaries. You can change clipping behavior by setting properties of the Grid object. See the Grid Class for more information.

code.title: Using the Grid property to access the Grid object
Using the Grid property to access the Grid object

example.code: With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart.Grid 'Turn grid lines on for X and Y axes .AxisX.GridLinesOn = True .AxisY.GridLinesOn = True 'Make grid lines dotted .AxisX.GridLineProperties.DashStyle = System.Drawing.Drawing2D.DashStyle.Dot .AxisY.GridLineProperties.DashStyle = System.Drawing.Drawing2D.DashStyle.Dot End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.Legend
member.summary: Gets the Legend object that provides the chart's legend. The Legend property exists to provide access to the properties and methods of the underlying Legend object.
member.remarks: The legend includes text read from the Series.SeriesName property for each data series shown on the chart, along with a box or line showing the color used to represent the series. You can arrange the list horizontally or vertically, and you can lay it out in one or more columns. You can hide the legend by setting its IsVisible property to False. See the Legend Class for more information.

code.title: Using the Legend property to access the Legend object
Using the Legend property to access the Legend object

example.code: With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart.Legend 'Do NOT display the legend item text in 'the same color as the series it represents .AutoTextColor = False 'Display a box rather than an icon for each item .BoxMode = LegendBoxMode.BoxesOn End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.AnnotationList
member.summary: Gets the AnnotationCollection object that maintains annotations on the chart. The AnnotationList property exists to provide access to the methods of the underlying AnnotationCollection object.
member.remarks:
An annotation is a text object that can be placed anywhere on the chart, and can be used to add axis titles, or subtitles, or simply to append information that clarifies some aspect of the chart. The AnnotationList property contains a collection of all the chart's annotations.
To create a chart annotation, first allocate an Annotation object, then add it to the chart's annotation collection by calling the Add method.

code.title: Adding an annotation to the chart
Adding an annotation to the chart

example.code:
'Create an annotation Dim ann As New Annotation With ann .Text = "What caused the spike in apple sales?" .Background.Color = Color.LightGoldenrodYellow 'Make it yellow, like a sticky note .Border.EdgeEffectType = EdgeEffectType.DropShadow .Size = New Size(110, 85) .AutoSizeText = False 'Turn off autosizing when you want a specific font size .TextFormat.Font = New Font("Microsoft Sans Serif", 10) .TextFormat.VerticalAlignment = StringAlignment.Center End With
With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart 'Add the annotation to the chart .AnnotationList.Add(ann) 'Position it relative to the grid .SetRelativeLocation(ann, .Grid, RelativeLocation.RightTop) End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ChartEventsToEnable
member.summary: Gets the ChartEventWrapper object that enables and disables Chart events. The ChartEventsToEnable property exists to provide access to the underlying ChartEventWrapper object.
member.remarks: The properties of the ChartEventWrapper object act as switches that enable and disable all events that the Chart object can fire. In addition to enabling an event, you must also delegate a handler for it. See the example below.

code.title: Setting up a mouse click marker event
Setting up a mouse click marker event

example.code:
'Set up mouse click marker chart events With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart .Grid.IsSelectable = False 'We don't want clicking in the grid to select the grid .ChartEventsToEnable.EnableMarkerMouseClickEvent = True End With
AddHandler Me.GsNetWinChart1.MouseClickMarkerEvent, AddressOf Me.GsNetWinChart1_MouseClickMarkerEvent
. . .
Private Sub GsNetWinChart1_MouseClickMarkerEvent(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.MarkerMouseEventArgs) 'Extract the value of the data point Dim dataSeries As Series = e.SeriesDrawing.GetSeries() Dim pointValue As Double = dataSeries.GetValue(SeriesComponent.Y, e.DataPoint)
'Show it MessageBox.Show(pointValue.ToString()) End Sub

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.SeriesDrawingList
member.summary: Gets the SeriesDrawingCollection object that contains the SeriesDrawing objects currently attached to the chart. This property exists to provide access to the properties and methods of the underlying SeriesDrawingCollection object.
member.remarks:
In Graphics Server .NET, data are managed by the Series class and the drawing characteristics of data are managed by the SeriesDrawing class. When you add a Series object to a chart by calling the AddSeries method, the system wraps the Series object in the SeriesDrawing class, creating a new SeriesDrawing object. This new object is added to the SeriesDrawingCollection object held in the chart's SeriesDrawingList property.
See the SeriesDrawingCollection and the SeriesDrawing classes for more information.

example.code: 'Display the name of each series in the list With Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart.SeriesDrawingList Dim i As Integer For i = 0 To (.Count - 1) MessageBox.Show(.GetSeriesDrawing(i).SeriesName) Next End With

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ImageMapUrl
member.summary: Sets and gets the URL to load when the chart is clicked on.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.TooltipText
member.summary: Indicates the text to display in the popup tooltip.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ImageMapExtraString
member.summary: Specifies an extra string to embed in the chart's image map entry.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.EnableWebHotSpots
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to enable hot spots for Web images.
member.remarks: Features enabled include the ToolTipText and ImageMapUrl properties for all visual elements as well as the ImageMapExtraString properties in the Chart and SeriesDrawing objects.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.AutoSizeText
member.summary: Toggles all element level AutoSizeText properties to either true or false.
member.remarks: The setting of this property is not persistent and has no real meaning by itself.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.RunTimeProperties
member.summary: Gets the chart's PropertyPageEnabler object. This property exists to provide access to the properties and methods of the underlying PropertyPageEnabler object.
member.remarks: The PropertyPageEnabler object contains settings that control the context menu items, starting property page, and which property pages to display at run time. See the PropertyPageEnabler class for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.AutoInvalidate
member.summary: Controls whether the chart recalculates its layout and redraws every time a property setting is modified.
member.remarks: The default is false, which means that modifying properties does not cause the chart to recalculate its layout and redraw.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the displayed chart.
member.remarks:
Set this property only when you are using the Chart object independently of the GSNetWinChart or GSNetWebChart control.
When you are using one of the controls, you should not modify the Size property of the Chart object directly. Instead, set the size property of the parent GSNetWinChart or GSNetWebChart object and let the Chart object inherit the change.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.SmoothingMode
member.summary: Specifies whether smoothing (antialiasing) is applied to lines and curves on the chart.
member.remarks: This property does not affect the smoothing mode for text elements. For text smoothing, use the text element's TextRenderingMode property.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.AnimatedGif
member.summary: AnimatedGif allows one to add individual Images, or Bitmaps, to create an animation, or slideshow.
member.remarks: This requires that one assigns each frame of the animation themself. One can also define the speed of the animation.

member.name: E:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ChartSelectionChangedEvent

member.remarks: This event is used extensively in the GSNetWinChart control, which hooks into the event and forces a redraw when properties change. See the ChartChangedEventHandler delegate for more information.

The GSNetWinChart control wraps this event and fires its own MouseClickChartEvent event. When using the GSNetWinChart control, hook into its event instead of the one in the Chart class.

member.name: E:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.OnPostPaintEvent
member.summary: Fires after the chart finishes painting.
member.remarks: Use this event to do custom painting on top of the chart. See the PostPaintEventHandler delegate for more information.

member.name: E:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.OnPrePaintEvent
member.summary: Fires before the chart paints.
member.remarks: Use this event to do custom painting before the chart does any painting. See the PrePaintEventHandler delegate for more information.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ChartChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Handles the chart changed event.
member.remarks: Note that the GSNetWinChart control handles this event so it should not be handled unless the Chart class is being used independent of the Windows form control. See ChartChangedEventArgs for more information.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ChartMouseEventHandler
member.summary: Handles the various chart mouse events.
member.remarks: See ChartMouseEventArgs for more information.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ChartReadTemplateEventHandler
member.summary: Handles the ChartReadTemplateEvent, which fires when the chart reads a template via the ReadTemplate method.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ChartMarkerEventHandler
member.summary: Handles the various marker mouse events.
member.remarks: See ChartChangedEventArgs for more information.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.ChartSelectionChangedHandler
member.summary: Handles the selecting and unselecting of visual chart objects within the chart.
member.remarks: Note that when the selection changes from one object to another object, this event is sent twice. The first time indicates which object is being unselected (sender is object being unselected), and the second time indicates the object being selected (sender is the object being selected). The ChartSelectionChangedEventArgs will have data indicating whether the sender is being selected or unselected.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.PostPaintEventHandler
member.summary: Handles the OnPostPaintEvent.
member.remarks:
The PaintEventArgs contain a Graphics object that can be used to paint on top of the chart.
If you want to paint before the chart does any painting, hook into the OnPrePaintEvent.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.Chart.PrePaintEventHandler
member.summary: Handles the OnPrePaintEvent.
member.remarks:
The OnPrePaintEvent fires after the chart's background is drawn and before the grid, legend, titles and annotations are drawn. Painting inside this event will therefore paint on top of the Chart's background.
If you want to paint after the chart does all its painting, hook into the OnPostPaintEvent.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.EventAxisValues
member.summary: Provides information about chart axes when a chart or marker mouse event occurs.
member.remarks: The EventAxisValues class is implemented as a property in the class. When a chart or marker mouse event occurs, the properties in this class are filled in with values for the corresponding axis systems that are active in the chart. Note that these values are not screen coordinates but actual axis system values.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSAnchorStyles
member.summary: Supports anchoring in Graphics Server .NET.
member.remarks:
This enumeration includes the same anchor styles as the .Net AnchorStyles enumeration, and the behavior of anchoring in Graphics Server .NET is identical to the behavior of anchoring in standard .Net forms.
The GSAnchorStyles enumeration was created due to a documented .Net framework problem (Knowledge Base Article - 825082) when using bitmask type enumerations declared with the FlagsAttribute. The GSAnchorStyles enumeration, therefore, has a single value for all combinations of left, right, top and bottom.
Note, however, that anchor values can still be set by OR-ing the primitive values together. For example:
Chart.Grid.Anchor = GSAnchorStyles.Left | GSAnchorStyles.Right;

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags.ReconcileAxisBeforeReadingProperties
member.summary: This flag can be set to true if it appears that some axis properties read in from the XML do not stick. There are some axis properties that are reconciled and assigned based on the current chart type (e.g. IsGapAligned, BarOverlap, AxisMode, and AxisScale to name a few).

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags.IgnoreDefaults
member.summary: This flag is only used when saving properties to XML. If this flag is set to true then any property that is still the default value will NOT be saved to XML. Use this flag to reduce the size of the XML file.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags.IgnoreChartTitleLocation
member.summary: When set to true this property will ignore the location property of the chart title when reading and writing data from/to XML.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags.IgnoreAnnotations
member.summary: When set to true this property will ignore all the annotations attached to the chart.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags.ClearAnnotations
member.summary:
When set to true this property will clear the annotations in the pre-existing chart.
When set to true the chart will only contain the annotations from the template. If IgnoreAnnotations is also true then no annotations will appear in the chart after loading the template.
When set to false the annotations in the pre-existing chart will remain after the template is loaded. If IgnoreAnnotations is also false then the additional annotations from the template will be added to the chart.
Note that the ClearAnnotations flag is ignored when saving a template.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags.IgnoreSeriesDrawingProperties
member.summary:
When this flag is set to true the will not be witten to or read from the XML data. When this flag is false the properties for each SeriesDrawing object currently in the chart will be written out to the XML data. Note that the actual series data will NOT be written out.
When this flag is false and the process is reading properties in from the XML data the SeriesDrawing properties will be applied as follows:
1. The SeriesDrawing properties are read in sequentially in the same order they were written to the XML data.
2. The properties for the first SeriesDrawing object in the XML data will be applied to the first SeriesDrawing object in the chart if it exists.
3. The properties for the second SeriesDrawing object in the XML data will be applied to the second SeriesDrawing object in the chart if it exists.
4. And so on as long as there are SeriesDrawing objects in the XML data and there are SeriesDrawing objects in the chart.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags.IgnoreSeriesName
member.summary: SeriesDrawing objects have a property called SeriesName. When writing and reading properties back in, it may not be desirable to read in and overwrite a SeriesName in an exiting chart SeriesDrawing object. The default for this flag is true such that these names will be ignored. Set this flag to false if you wish to write out and read in the SeriesName property.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags.IgnoreTrends
member.summary: Trends objects can be attached to SeriesDrawing objects. Setting this property to false will cause the SeriesDrawing objects to write out and read in trend object data. Note that the IgnoreSeriesDrawingProperties must be false otherwise SeriesDrawing objects will not be able to read and write trend data.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags.IgnoreQuickLayout
member.summary: When set to true this property will ignore the Quick Layout information when reading and writing data from/to XML.
member.remarks: Quick layout data consists of relative size and location data for the Grid, the Legend and the Chart Title. This data is much more useful within a template versus the absolute size and location data for each of these objects. When this data is read back in the objects will be sized and positioned based on the current chart size and the relative data being read back in.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags.IgnoreAnnotationLayout
member.summary: When set to true this property will ignore the Annotation Layout information when reading and writing data from/to XML.
member.remarks: Annotation layout data consists of relative size and location data for the existing annotations. This data is much more useful within a template versus the absolute size and location data for each annotation. When this data is read back in the annotations will be sized and positioned based on the current chart size and the relative data being read back in.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.ArrayDataProvider
member.summary: ArrayDataProvider will allow binding an Array to a .

example.code:
Dim chart As Chart = Me.GsNetWinChart1.Chart
' create an array of data Dim dataArray() As Double = {15.0, 25.0, 8.0, 32.0, 9.0, 21.0, 29.0, 33.0, 11.0, 5.0}
' use an ArrayDataProvider to bind data to series Dim prov As ArrayDataProvider = New ArrayDataProvider(dataArray)
' bind to Y Dim ser As Series = New Series ser.BindComponent(SeriesComponent.Y, prov, String.Empty)
' remove old data from chart chart.RemoveAllSeries() ' add new (array) series to chart chart.AddSeries(ser)
' refresh chart chart.RecalcLayout()

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IDataProvider
member.summary: This is a required data provider interface. At this time there are no specific methods or properties to implement in this interface. The purpose of this interface is to generically pass around a data provider reference regardless of the specific data provider type.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IConnection
member.summary: This is a required data provider interface. This interface contains methods and properties that allow the data provider to connect to the encapsulated source of data. Each specific data provider may implement the properties and methods to suit that data provider's purpose. See the documentation for the specific data provider to understand how to use these properties and methods.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IConnection.OpenConnection
member.summary: Opens the connection to the data source within the data provider. If the connection cannot be opened a DPConnectionException will be thrown.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IConnection.CloseConnection
member.summary: Closes the data provider connection.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IConnection.RefreshConnection
member.summary: Use this method once the connection has been opened via the OpenConnection command. This method will refresh the connection based on any of the connection properties that have been modified.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IConnection.IsConnected
member.summary: Call this method to see if the data provider is currently connected to it source and ready to return data.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IConnection.DoesFieldSourceExist(System.Object)
member.summary: Use this method to query whether the specified field source exists in an opened data provider.
member.param: This object represents a specific source of data in the data provider.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IConnection.IsNumberType(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified field source supports number type data.
member.param: This object represents a specific source of data in the data provider.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IConnection.ConnectionString
member.summary: This property contains the connection string utilized by the data provider to successfully connect to a data source. The general thought is that all data providers will require a connection string in order to find the data source.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IConnection.SelectString
member.summary: This property contains the selection string utilized by a data source. This property may not be required by all data provides. Database related data providers most likely require an SQL SELECT...FROM...WHERE type of clause. A data provider accessing text files may not require this a select string. See the specific data provider for full requirements concerning use of this string and formatting issues.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IDataRetrieve
member.summary: This is a required data provider interface. Implement this data provider interface to support the ability to retrieve data from the data provider.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IDataRetrieve.DataPointCount(System.Object)
member.summary: Number of data points for the specified field source. Note that for database related data providers the number of data points is typically the same for all field sources (i.e. the number of records in the database).
member.param: This object represents a specific source of data in the data provider.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IDataRetrieve.FindMinMaxValues(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
This method will walk all the values in the specified field source and return the minimum and maximum values for the datapoints that fall within the startDataPoint and endDataPoint range inclusively. Note that all data points are specified as a 0-based index.
If either startDataPoint or endDataPoint is less than zero then this method will find the min and max values across all the datapoints in the data provider.
member.param: This object represents a specific source of data in the data provider.
The first data point of the range.
The last data point of the range.
The miniumn value in the field source is returned in this param.
The maximumn value in the field source is returned in this param.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IDataRetrieve.GetValue(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method returns a value for the specified field source at the specified data point. Note that the data is returned as a double. Calling this method for a non number type of field source will return 0. Calling this method for a data point that does not exist will also return a zero. Note that the dataPoint is 0-based indexed.
member.param: This object represents a specific source of data in the data provider.
The data point to return data for.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IDataRetrieve.GetLabel(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method returns a value for the specified field source at the specified data point. Note that the data is returned as a string even if the field source contains numeric data. Calling this method for a data point that does not exist will return a null. Note that the dataPoint is a 0-based index.
member.param: This object represents a specific source of data in the data provider.
The data point to return data for.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IDataInsert
member.summary: This is an optional data provider Interface. Implement this interface if the data provider needs to support the ability to insert data into the data source.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.IDataInsert.SetValue(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the specified value at the datapoint in the field source. Note that since the value is an object it can be numeric or a string. Also note that the dataPoint is a 0-based index.
member.param: This object represents a specific source of data in the data provider.
The data point to set data for.
The data to set in the data source. Can be numeric or textual.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.DPConnectionException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when an attempt to connect to a data source fails. A connect attempt may fail for various reasons. The specified data source may not exist or the specified select string may be invalid. The message in the exception should contain the reason for the failure.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.DataSetDataProvider
member.summary: Supports a connection between a table from a dataset and the charting engine.
member.remarks:
Note that a dataset object may contain more than one table. The data provider, however, can expose only one table at a time to the charting engine. Use the InitializeTable method to switch between tables. Once you switch to a different table, you must remove all the series that have been bound to the original table and create one or more new series to bind to the new table.
To bind to more than one table at the same time within the dataset, simply create multiple DataSetDataProviders and place the same dataset into each data provider. Then initialize each data provider to a different table.
This data provider now supports writing data back into the dataset using the SetValue method.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.OleDBDataProvider
member.summary: Supports connections between OleDb data sources and the charting engine. Connecting to a data source requires both a ConnectionString and a SelectString.
member.remarks: This data provider uses the notion of a field source, which it defines as a database field. Field sources are passed in via a string and are specified in the SelectString property. For example, a SelectString defined as "SELECT JAN, FEB FROM SALES" contains two field sources, JAN and FEB.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.OleDBDataProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.OleDBDataProvider.OpenConnection
member.summary: Opens a connection to an OleDB data source using the specified connection string.
member.remarks:
If the connection fails to open, a DataProviderException is thrown. Refer to the message in that exception to understand why the connection failed.
Internally this data provider uses ADO.NET technology and a DataSet object. This means that this data provider implements the disconnected recordset concept.Once data is retrieved, the physical connnection to the OleDB data source is closed.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.OleDBDataProvider.CloseConnection
member.summary: Closes the data provider connection.
member.remarks: Note that this data provider implements a disconnected record set concept so calling this method does not actually do anything.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.OleDBDataProvider.RefreshConnection
member.summary: Refreshes the connection using any connection properties that have been modified.
member.remarks: Use this method once the connection has been opened via the OpenConnection command. For example, you could change the SelectString property to change the ordering of the datapoints and then call RefreshConnection to view the new ordering. Note, however, that if the data provider has been bound to series objects, then you must be careful not to remove any of bound field sources from the select string.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.OleDBDataProvider.IsConnected
member.summary: Call this method to see if the data provider is currently connected to its source and ready to return data.

member.summary: Use this method to query whether the specified field source exists in an opened data provider.
member.param: The name of a OleDB data source field.

member.param: The name of a OleDB data source field.

member.summary: This method will walk all the values in the specified field source and return the minimum and maximum values for the datapoints that fall within the startDataPoint and EndDataPoint range inclusively. Note that all data points are specified using a 0-based index.
member.remarks: If either startDataPoint or endDataPoint is less than zero, this method will find the min and max values across all the datapoints in the data provider.
member.param: The name of a OleDB data source field.
The first data point of the range.
The last data point of the range.
The miniumn value in the field source is returned in this param.
The maximumn value in the field source is returned in this param.

member.remarks: Note that the data is returned as a double. Calling this method for a non-numeric type of field source will return 0. Calling this method for a data point that does not exist will also return 0.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series
member.summary: The Series object can be instantiated and used independently of the Chart object. The Series object is simply a data store consisting of one to many components. Each defined/bound component is an independent data container.
member.remarks:
The SeriesComponent enumeration defines the components that can exist in a Series object. Note that these component types have specific names like X, Y, Open, and Polar. The concept is that various chart types require different data components. For example, a scatter chart requires X and Y data, while an Open-High-Low-Close chart requires data for the opening, high, low, and closing price.
Because the Series object is independent of the Chart object, it can be added to more than one Chart object simultaneously. The Chart object uses the Series object as a read-only data source and therefore will not compromise any data within the Series.
When a Series object is added to a Chart, the Chart wraps the Series object inside an object called SeriesDrawing. The SeriesDrawing object then exposes drawing properties that can be modified for that Series within that specific Chart. Note once again that modifying SeriesDrawing object properties does not change any data within the Series nor does it affect SeriesDrawing properties of other Charts if that same Series is added to more than one Chart.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.HasComponent(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified component exists in the Series.
member.returns: Returns true if the specific component exists in the Series.
member.example: See the example for the SetValue method.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.BindComponent(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Binds a series component to a specific field source in a data provider.
member.remarks:
This method creates a component as specified by the component type and then binds that component to the field source of the specified data provider. Note that prior to calling this method, the data provider should be completely set up and connected to a data source.
If the specified Series Component already exists and is already bound, then that component is removed and a new component is created.
member.exception: Indicates a data parameter is bad. Refer to the message in the exception for detailed information.
member.param: Value from the enum.
Fully constructed Data Provider.
Name of a field in the Data Provider.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.DataPointCount(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent)
member.summary: Returns the count of data points for the specified component.
member.remarks: In general, if all components of a Series are bound to the same data provider, then the data point count should be the same for all components. If, however, each component of a Series is bound to a different data provider, then there is a chance the data point count is different for each component. If the component does not exist, then the count returned is 0.
member.returns: The number of datapoints that exist for the specified component type.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.FindMinMaxValues(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: This method will walk the values in the specified component and return the minimum and maximum values for the start through end data points. Note that all data points are specified using a 0-based index.
member.remarks: If either startDataPoint or endDataPoint is less than zero, then the min and max values are returned for all datapoints.
member.exception: Indicates a data parameter is bad.
member.param: Value from the enum.
The first data point to display.
The last data point to display.
The minimum value in the field source is returned in this param.
The maximum value in the field source is returned in this param.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.GetValue(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method returns a value for the specified component at the specified data point.
member.remarks: Note that the data is returned as a double. Calling this method for a non-numeric type of field source will return 0. Calling this method for a data point that does not exist also returns 0. Calling this method for a component that does not exist returns the integer passed in as the dataPoint argument.
member.exception: Indicates a data parameter is bad.
member.param: Value from the enum.
The 0-based index of the data point for which to return data.
member.returns: Returns the value associated to the data point.

member.summary: This method returns a value for the specified component at the specified data point.
member.remarks: Note that the data is returned as a string even if the field source contains numeric data. Calling this method for a data point that does not exist returns the integer passed in as the dataPoint argument.
member.param: Value from the enum.
The data point to return data for.
member.returns: Returns the value associated to the data point as a string.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.Randomize(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method hooks a randomized data provider to the specified component.
member.remarks:
If the specified component already exists, then it is removed and a new component is created.
Hooking a component to this method causes the data points to regenerate each time the grid area is repainted. The series draws differently each time the grid repaints because the component has different data each time.
This method does not work well with 3D charts; instead use the RandomizeComponent() method.
member.param: Value from the enum.
The number of random datapoints for this component.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.IsRandomized(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent)
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether the specified component is currently returning randomized data.
member.param: Value from the enum.
member.returns: Returns true if this component is randomized.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.SetValue(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: This method sets the specified value at the data point within the component.
member.remarks:
If the component is bound to a data provider that does not support setting data, then an exception is thrown (i.e. OleDB bound components will throw an exception).
If the component is currently randomized, calling this method removes the randomized component, recreates the component, and binds it internally to a memory data provider.
member.exception: Indicates a data parameter is bad

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.GetComponentFieldSource(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent)
member.summary: Returns the name of the field source within the specified component.
member.remarks: Null is returned if the component does not exist or i the data provider does not support field sources.
member.param: Value from the enum
member.returns: Returns the name of the field source.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.RemoveComponent(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent)
member.summary: Removes the specified component from the series if it exists.
member.param: Value from the enum.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.Series.RandomizeComponent(GraphicsServer.GSNet.SeriesData.SeriesComponent,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Randomizes the specified component.
member.remarks: This method differs from the Randomize method in that it creates random values and then sets those random values into the specified component via the SetValue() method. Therefore the random values are fixed for as long as the series exists. In other words, the random values do not jump around each time the grid area is repainted.
member.param: Value from the enum.
Total number of points to create.
min random value.
max random value.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart
member.summary: The GSNetWebChart object is a Web Control that encapsulates a Chart object. This Web Control is a native .NET server control. It can be placed on a web form to provide easy access to the Chart object configuration properties.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.SaveToViewState(System.String,GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags)
member.summary: Saves a subset of chart properties to a view state.
member.remarks:
Chart properties are saved to the GSNetWebChart's ViewState based on flags in the parameter. The TemplateFlags class provides the means to save specific subsets of the chart properties. To save different sets of properties, simply call this method multiple times using a different name parameter with each call.
When loading the properties back in from the ViewState, use the method. Note that LoadFromViewState has two overrides. One override requires a TemplateFlags parameter and the other override does not. The easiest method to load properties is the override that does not require the TemplateFlags parameter.

example.para: The following example shows how to save SeriesDrawing properties and legend properties and then read them back in from the ViewState.

member.param: The name specifies which state bag to save the chart properties under.
The template flags specify which chart properties you want to save and which you want to ignore. For more information see .

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.SaveToViewState(System.String)
member.summary: Saves all the chart's properties to the GSNetWebChart's ViewState.
member.remarks: Internally this method allocates a TemplateFlags class and sets all the ignore flags to false, which causes all properties to be saved.
member.param: The name specifies which state bag to save the chart properties under.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.LoadFromViewState(System.String,GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.TemplateFlags)
member.summary: Loads specified chart properties from a previously saved ViewState.
member.remarks:
The name parameter must equal the name parameter used when the properties were saved. Note that this method requires a
object to specify which properties to load. If you would like to load all the properties saved for the specified name, then it is much easier to call the overload that does not require the TemplateFlags object.
member.param: The name specifies which state bag to load the properties under.
The template flags specify which properties you want to load and which you want to ignore. For more information see .

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.LoadFromViewState(System.String)
member.summary: Loads all chart properties from a previously saved ViewState.
member.remarks: The name parameter must equal the name parameter used when the properties were saved. Internally this method allocates a TemplateFlags class and sets all the ignore flags to false which causes all properties that were saved out to be loaded.
member.param: The name specifies which state bag to load the properties under.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.AutoSizeChartObjects
member.summary: DEPRECATED This property and the corresponding functionality have been replaced with chart object Anchor properties. Chart object anchoring works in a way that is similar to anchoring of controls within forms. This property has been left for backward compatibility.
member.remarks:
Note that if this property is true then anchoring will be disabled.
If this property is true, then in design time all the internal chart objects resize based on the new size of the control.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.LogDeletedFiles
member.summary: Enables and disables logging of deleted image files.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true will log all deleted files. The log file will be created in the run-time image folder. The name of the file is GSNetDeletedFiles.log.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.RunTimeImagesFolderLocation
member.summary: Sets and gets the relative location of the folder where temporary image files created by the control are stored.
member.remarks:
Use the enumeration to specify the relative location for the run-time image folder. The name of this folder can be specified using the property.
See Managing Web Image Files for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.RunTimeDir
member.summary: Assigns the name of the run-time image folder where generated image files are stored and referenced by the client side generated html. Requires that RunTimeImagesFolderLocation is UnderDefaultWebSite or UnderWebApplication.
member.remarks:
The value of this property can be either a single directory name or a relative path plus directory name (for example, MyImages, images/.../MyImages).
The location of the directory is determined by setting of this property plus the setting of the property. The RunTimeDir is only used when RunTimeImagesFolderLocation is UnderDefaultWebSite or UnderWebApplication.
If the RunTimeDir property is left blank, the control checks the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Graphics Server Technologies\GSNet\RunTimeDir registry setting for a run-time image folder name. If that registry setting does not exist, the run-time image folder name defaults to GSNetImages.
See Managing Web Image Files for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.FilesToDelete
member.summary: Specifies the number of run-time image files to delete each time the control's directory cleanup routine executes.
member.remarks:
The control's directory cleanup routine runs each time the control loads. If this property is not set (i.e. a value of -1 means not set), then the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Graphics Server Technologies\GSNet\FilesToDelete registry key is checked for a value. If that key does not exist, then the number of files to delete defaults to 20.
See Managing Web Image Files for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.MinutesOld
member.summary: Specifies the age criteria, in minutes, for deleting temporary image files created by the control.
member.remarks:
If the MinutesOld property is not set (i.e. a value or -1 means not set), then the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Graphics Server Technologies\GSNet\MinutesOld registry key is checked for a value. If that key does not exist, then the default setting is 30 minutes.
See Managing Web Image Files for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.DeleteASPNetTempFiles
member.summary: Deletes temporary files the web control creates from the 'ASPNET Temporary Files' folder.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true will log delete all temporary files the web control creates in the 'Documents and Settings\MachineName\ASPNET\Local Settings\Temp' folder. The policy for deleting these files will be defined by the FilesToDelete and MinutesOld properties.

This property works in conjunction with the DeleteASPNetTempFileMode property. The DeleteASPNetTempFileMode property will determine whether to delete all files or just the ones created by the web control.
A log file in the ASPNET Temporary Files directory will store the filenames that the web control has created but not yet deleted.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.DeleteASPNetTempFileMode
member.summary: Sets whether to delete all files or just the ones created by the web control.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.RuntimeImageFileName
member.summary: Gets the full path and file name of the run-time image file that was generated and referenced in the client side HTML page.
member.remarks: Note that this property will return an empty string if the control has not yet rendered.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.ImageFileMode
member.summary: Determines how the temporary images are created when the Web page is executed.
member.remarks: The default setting is ImageFileMode.WriteToDisk. If your application does not have the security permissions needed for this mode, you can set ImageFileMode.ByteStream.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.ImageHardDiskFolder
member.summary: Sets and gets a path to the physical folder on the machine where temporary images will be written.
member.remarks: This property is ignored unless the RunTimeImagesFolderLocation property is set to RunTimeImagesFolderLocation.UserDefined and the ImageVirtualDirectory property is set to the name of a virtual directory. The virtual directory, through its Web site virtual path, must match up with the ImageHardDiskFolder so that they are both pointing to the same folder on the machine. If both paths do not point to the same folder, images will not display when the Web page is downloaded to the client browser.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.ImageVirtualDirectory
member.summary: Sets and gets the name of the virtual folder where temporary images will be referenced from the Web page.
member.remarks: This property is ignored unless the RunTimeImagesFolderLocation property is set to RunTimeImagesFolderLocation.UserDefined and the ImageHardDiskFolder property is set with a path to the physical folder. The virtual directory, through its Web site virtual path, must match up with the ImageHardDiskFolder so that they are both pointing to the same folder on the machine. If both paths do not point to the same folder, images will not display when the Web page is downloaded to the client browser.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.GSNetWebChart.AnimatedGifEnabled
member.summary: Enables and disables whether to use the AnimatedGif defined within the Chart.

remarks.para: If this property is set to true, the AnimatedGif produced by the chart is displayed by the Web browser instead of the current chart image.
When false, the current chart image is displayed.

The value of this property can be either a single directory name or a relative path plus directory name (for example, MyImages, images/.../MyImages).
The location of the directory is determined by setting of this property plus the setting of the property.
If the RunTimeDir property is left blank, the control checks the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Graphics Server Technologies\GSNet\RunTimeDir registry setting for a run-time image folder name. If that registry setting does not exist, the run-time image folder name defaults to GSNetImages.
See Managing Web Image Files for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.LiveGSNetWebChart.FilesToDelete
member.summary: Specifies the number of run-time image files to delete each time the control's directory cleanup routine executes.
member.remarks:
The control's directory cleanup routine runs each time the control loads. If this property is not set (i.e. a value of -1 means not set), then the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Graphics Server Technologies\GSNet\FilesToDelete registry key is checked for a value. If that key does not exist, then the number of files to delete defaults to 20.
See Managing Web Image Files for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.LiveGSNetWebChart.MinutesOld
member.summary: Specifies the age criteria, in minutes, for deleting temporary image files created by the control.
member.remarks:
If the MinutesOld property is not set (i.e. a value or -1 means not set), then the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Graphics Server Technologies\GSNet\MinutesOld registry key is checked for a value. If that key does not exist, then the default setting is 30 minutes.
See Managing Web Image Files for more information.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.LiveGSNetWebChart.DeleteASPNetTempFiles
member.summary: Deletes temporary files the web control creates from the 'ASPNET Temporary Files' folder.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true will log delete all temporary files the web control creates in the 'ASPNET Temporary Files' folder. The policy for deleting these files will be defined by the FilesToDelete and MinutesOld properties.

This property works in conjunction with the DeleteASPNetTempFileMode property. The DeleteASPNetTempFileMode property will determine whether to delete all files or just the ones created by the web control.
A log file in the ASPNET Temporary Files directory will store the filenames that the web control has created but not yet deleted.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.LiveGSNetWebChart.DeleteASPNetTempFileMode
member.summary: Sets whether to delete all files or just the ones created by the web control.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.LiveGSNetWebChart.RuntimeImageFileName
member.summary: Gets the full path and file name of the run-time image file that was generated and referenced in the client side HTML page.
member.remarks: Note that this property will return an empty string if the control has not yet rendered.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.LiveGSNetWebChart.ImageFileMode
member.summary: The ImageFileMode will determine how the image will get created when the web page is executed.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.LiveGSNetWebChart.ImageHardDiskFolder
member.summary: The ImageHardDiskFolder assigns the physical folder on the machine where the images will be written to. Requires that the RunTimeImagesFolderLocation is set to UserDefined.
member.remarks: When using the ImageHardDiskFolder property, then one must also set RunTimeImagesFolderLocation to UserDefined and assign the ImageVirtualDirectory. The ImageVirtualDirectory, through its website virtual path, must match up with the ImageHardDiskFolder so that they are both pointing to the same folder on the machine. It is the user's duty to verify both paths point to the same folder, otherwise one would presumably get a broken image when running the web page in a web browser.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.LiveGSNetWebChart.ImageVirtualDirectory
member.summary: The ImageVirtualDirectory assigns the virtual folder where the images will be referenced from the web page. Requires that the RunTimeImagesFolderLocation is set to UserDefined.
member.remarks: When using the ImageVirtualDirectory property, then one must also set RunTimeImagesFolderLocation to UserDefined and assign the ImageHardDiskFolder. The ImageVirtualDirectory, through its website virtual path, must match up with the ImageHardDiskFolder so that they are both pointing to the same folder on the machine. It is the user's duty to verify both paths point to the same folder, otherwise one would presumably get a broken image when running the web page in a web browser.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.RunTimeImagesFolderLocation
member.summary: Values of this enumeration are used to specify the location of the run-time image folder on the Web server.

remarks.para: This enumeration is implemented by the property and the property.

The Web control generates image files that are referenced in the server side generated HTML pages sent back to the user's client side browser. These generated image files are created in the run-time image folder.
The run-time image folder can be located in either one of two places:

list.item: Under the default Web site (for example, c:\inetpub\wwwroot\gsnetimages).
Under the Web application's directory (for example, c:\inetpub\wwwroot\myapp\gsnetimages).

remarks.para: The actual name of the run-time image folder defaults to the name GSNetImages if not overridden. The name of this folder can be overridden in one of two ways. The property can be used to specify a relative folder structure. Or the registry can be used to specify this relative folder by placing the folder name in the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Graphics Server Technologies\GSNet\RunTimeDir key. Note that the RunTimeDir property takes precedence over the registry key.

If the setup on your server requires using virtual directories, set the RunTimeDir property to RunTimeImagesFolderLocation.UserDefined and then set the control's ImageHardDiskFolder and ImageVirtualDirectory properties.

Note that in order for images to be successfully created in the run-time image folder, the image folder must exist and have security permissions such that the Web application can create and delete files in that folder.
You can avoid the need to create and delete files on the server by setting the control's ImageFileMode property to ImageFileMode.ByteStream.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.RunTimeImagesFolderLocation.UnderDefaultWebSite
member.summary: Runtime image folder will reside under the IIS default web site.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.RunTimeImagesFolderLocation.UnderWebApplication
member.summary: Runtime image folder will reside under the application directory.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.RunTimeImagesFolderLocation.UserDefined
member.summary: User defined folder location requires that both the ImageHardDiskFolder and ImageVirtualDirectory are assigned by the user and that the physical and virtual paths link to the same folder.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ImageFileMode
member.summary: The ImageFileMode will determine how the image will get created when the web page is executed.

remarks.para: Be aware that when writing the image file to the hard disk, the appropriate security permissions are needed in certain folders in order create the image file name and to write the file to disk. See Managing Web Image Files for more information.

When bytestreaming the image, no security permissions are needed for any folders. However one must be aware that the bytestream uses a querystring named "GSNetWebChartID" in order to bytestream the image. Thus do not create a querystring with this same name when implementing your web page.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ImageFileMode.WriteToDisk
member.summary: The image file will be created on the hard disk.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.ImageFileMode.ByteStream
member.summary: The image file will be byte-streamed to the web page.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.DeleteASPNetTempFileMode
member.summary: Sets whether to delete all temporary files or just the ones created by the web control.
member.para: Be aware when setting to AllTempFiles, since other controls on the same web page might require their own temp files and their own creation and clean-up schemes.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.DeleteASPNetTempFileMode.OnlyWebControlFiles
member.summary: This will only delete the temp files created by the web control.

member.name: F:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Charting.DeleteASPNetTempFileMode.AllTempFiles
member.summary: This will delete all temp files in the folder, regardless of their creator.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.DeviceBase.AutoSize
member.summary: Controls whether the device automatically resizes itself to best fit within the available area.
member.remarks: The default setting is false. When AutoSize is set to true, the device ignores the settings for the MarginLeft, MarginRight, MarginTop, and MarginBottom properties and recalculates smaller margins that still allow room for the device and its labels. This feature is especially useful for small devices.

member.summary: Determines whether the tick scale line is visible.
member.remarks: The tick scale line is a line that draws from one end of the scale to the other. If you turn the line off by setting this property to false, tick marks will still draw as long as you have set MajorTicks to a value greater than zero.

members.member: Derived classes must implement the AutoReSize method so that the device will be best fit into the rectangle its contained within.

member.summary: Determines whether scale values draw in the reverse direction.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.AngularScaleDevice.StartAngle
member.summary: Sets and gets the start angle for the scale.
member.remarks: Valid values can range from 0 to 360. Angles are measured in a clockwise direction with 0 degrees at three o'clock.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.AngularScaleDevice.SweepAngle
member.summary: Sets and gets the span of the scale.
member.remarks:
Valid values can range from 0 to 360. Angles are measured in a clockwise direction with 0 degrees at three o'clock.
The scale will start at the specified
and extend the number of degrees specified by this property.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.AngularScaleDevice.ScaleOffsetDirection
member.summary: Sets and gets the relative location of the scale.
member.remarks: The setting for this property determines where the center point of the scale's arc is located. When set to ScaleOffsetDirection.Center, the center point of the arc is in the center of the device's drawing area. When set to ScaleOffsetDirection.TopLeft, the center point of the arc is the top left corner of the device's drawing area.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.Meter
member.summary: Represents a meter device.
member.remarks: A meter device has an angular scale, which can span from a partial arc all the way to a full circle. Like gauges, meters can have multiple needles, and you can set the width and color of each needle. Meters can also have zones, which can be defined to span a value range on the meter. There can be multiple zones defined for a meter, each with a different range, color and depth.

member.remarks: This property exists to provide access to the properties of the underlying Line object.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.NeedleBase.OutlineEnabled
member.summary: Enables and disables drawing of an outline around the needle.
member.remarks: Set to true to draw an outline.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.NeedleBase.LabelOn
member.summary: Enables and disables display of the needle value label.

remarks.para: Set to true to show the value of the needle in a label. You can specify a format mask using the LabelFormatMask property.
If you simply want to show the name of the needle, set the NeedleNameOn property instead.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.NeedleBase.NeedleNameOn
member.remarks: Set to true to display the text of the NeedleName property in the needle's label. If you want to display the needle's value, use the LabelOn property instead.
member.summary: Enables and disables display of the needle name in a label.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.NeedleBase.LabelOffset
member.summary: Sets and gets the offset of the needle label from the needle.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.NeedleBase.LabelProperties
member.summary: Gets the TextPainter object that provides the label for the needle.
member.remarks: This property exists to provide access to the properties of the underlyingTextPainter object.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.NeedleBase.LabelFormatMask
member.summary: Sets and gets the mask for formatting needle labels.
member.remarks: This property accepts any valid .NET format string that is accepted by the ToString() method. See the .NET documentation for more information. If this property is not set, the label uses the scale's format mask.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.MeterNeedle.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an instance of this type.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.MeterNeedle.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an instance of this type and sets the string argument in the NeedleName property.

example.code: // Create a meter needle MeterNeedle needleOhms = new MeterNeedle("Ohms");
' Create a meter needle Dim needleOhms As MeterNeedle = New MeterNeedle("Ohms")

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.MeterNeedle.Length
member.summary: Sets and gets the length of the needle.
member.remarks: This value is a percentage of the length from the center point to the scale. For example, a value of 100 draws the needle to the scale. A value of 50 draws the needle half way to the scale.

example.code: 'Create a needle to show the hour Dim needleHour As MeterNeedle = New MeterNeedle("hour") needleHour.Background.Color = Color.Black needleHour.Length = 75 needleHour.WidthAtBase = 6 needleHour.Value = 4

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.MeterNeedle.WidthAtBase
member.summary: This property sets and gets the width of the needle at the base.
member.remarks: This value is a percentage of the length from the center point to the scale.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.MeterNeedle.WidthAtEnd
member.summary: This property sets and gets the width of the needle cap at the end of the needle.

remarks.para: This value is a percentage of the radius from the center point to the edge of the scale.
The WidthAtEnd only applies when the MeterNeedleType is PinWithBaseCapEndCap.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.MeterNeedle.BorderLabelName
member.summary: The name of the BorderLabel in the device's BorderLabelList that will display the value of this needle.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.MeterNeedle.PinWidth
member.summary: Sets and gets the width of the pin portion of the needle when the MeterNeedleType is PinWithCap or PinWithBaseCapEndCap.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.MeterNeedleList
member.summary: This class is simply a wrapper around the array list that contains the list of MeterNeedle objects associated with an angular scale device such as a Meter object.
member.remarks: Typically, you do not access a MeterNeedleList object directly. Instead, you should access it through a Meter object's NeedleList property.

member.summary: Constructs an instance of this type.

member.summary: Adds a MeterNeedle object to the list.
member.remarks: This method is overridden for connecting the needle object to internal structures. Call this method to add a new MeterNeedle object to the list.
member.returns: Index in the list of the added needle.

member.summary: Removes a meter needle from the collection.

member.summary: Insert a MeterNeedle object at the specified index in the needle list.
member.remarks: If a meter needle exists at that index, it is replaced with the specified needle. If the index does not exist in the list, the needle is added to the end of the list.
member.returns: Index at which the MeterNeedle was set in the list.
member.param: Zero-based index.
MeterNeedle object to set into the list.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.FillBelowNeedleMax
member.summary: This fill condition sets a range of scale values for a gauge or slider device. When the largest of the needle values falls within or above the range, the conditional object fills the area from the lower end of the range to either the upper end of the range or the maximum needle value, whichever is less.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.FillMinMax
member.summary: This fill condition will fill between user-assigned minimum and maximum scale values.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.FillConditionBase
member.summary: This base class implements the interface and provides a quick and easy means of creating custom filled region condition objects.
member.remarks:
To use a fill condition object, you must instantiate the object, set the object's criteria, and then associate the fill condition object with a object.
A fill condition object can be associated with a LinearScaleDevice (Gauge, Slider, Thermometer) class by calling the method. The LinearScaleDevice class also provides other methods such as ,
and .
member.example: See the example for the LinearScaleDevice class's AddFillCondition method.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.IFillCondition
member.summary: IFillCondition interface contains properties and methods for supporting the conditional fill concept for Gauges, Sliders and Thermometers. Developers can build custom fill condition classes by implementing this interface.
member.remarks:
Note that a base class exists in the library that already implements this interface. (See .) This class can be used as a base class when creating custom fill condition classes versus directly implementing the IFillCondition interface.
For additional information regarding the use of fill condition objects see the class.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.IFillCondition.IsVisible
member.summary: Determines whether or not the fill will be visible.
member.remarks: One can perform checks against the LinearScaleDevice, or their derived classes Gauge, Slider or Thermometer, and determine whether or not to show the fill.
member.returns: True if the fill will be visible, false if the fill will not show.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.IFillCondition.MinValue
member.summary: Sets the minimum scale value that the fill will begin at.
member.returns: The minimum scale value that the fill will begin at.

member.name: M:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.IFillCondition.MaxValue
member.summary: Sets the maximum scale value that the fill will end at.
member.returns: The maximum scale value that the fill will end at.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.IFillCondition.Name
member.summary: This property is the name of the fill condition.
member.remarks: Although it is not necessary to name fill conditions, names may be useful for searching and finding specific fill condition objects later.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.IFillCondition.BackgroundFill
member.summary: Gets or sets the Background object used to paint a filled in region when its value(s) meet the criteria of the fill condition.

member.name: P:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.FillConditionBase.BackgroundFill
member.summary: Gets or sets the Background object used to paint a filled in region when its value(s) meet the criteria of the fill condition.
Provides access to the Background object contained in the protected propBackground property. Note that developers can override this property if desired.
member.remarks:
This property provides access to the Background object contained in the protected propBackground property. Developers can override this property if desired.
Note that the Background object here is used only to fill in the region specified, not to fill the entire Gauge, Slider or Thermometer.

member.name: T:GraphicsServer.GSNet.Widgets.Gauge
member.summary: Represents a gauge device.
member.remarks: A gauge device contains a linear scale that can be positioned horizontally or vertically. Gauges can have multiple needles, and each needle can be a different size, shape and style. Optional needle labels can display the current value.

member.summary: The original v2.5 method of resizing linear scale devices

members.member: Derived classes must implement the AutoReSize method so that the device will be best fit into the rectangle its contained within.
